review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because of its central location -- it's a 15-20 min drive from the Oakland airport, about a 10-15 min drive to downtown Oakland, and about 20 minutes from San Francisco. This hotel is located next to lots of shopping options, and it's also located next to the freeway, so it's easy to get back on the road again. The hotel and the room itself are clean and modern. Our room (two double beds) was a bit cramped, but matched our needs perfectly. The hotel staff at check-in and check-out were friendly, courteous, and efficient. There was parking at a moderate extra cost, but well worth it. After a long day of driving, we chose to eat at the hotel restaurant/bar. The food was pretty good, but the service wasn't great. Overall, though, I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, modern rooms and lobby space. Fitness center and spa facilities were clean. Hotel staff was pleasant. 24 hour snack center was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant/bar staff weren't great, but I'd still stay here.
review.locationRemarks: 15-20 min to the Oakland airport, 10 min to downtown Oakland, 20 min to SF, close to Berkley. Lots of shopping options nearby. Right on the Bay.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Looking for a hotel near airport for easy short drive in morning, it more than fit the bill. Nice place.

review.title: Nice hotel a short drive from San Francisco.
review.reviewText: No issues. Nice hotel. Windows could be cleaned. I would recommend to friends/family.

review.title: Stay Somewhere Else.
review.reviewText:
Staff was not helpful or didn't know basic questions about transportation and local restaurants
Room had a view of air conditioning units; the other choice was next to the elevators.
Bad stains in the carpet.  Hallways were filled with cigarette smoke.
No one to help with bags and no concierge.
Their excuse was always " this is a corporate event hotel."
Private experienced travelers obvious have higher standards than corporate kowtowing employees.
review.positiveRemarks: The driver who provided transport to and from hotel.  Very good service.
review.negativeRemarks: See experience above.

review.title: Small rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel location close to a mall and restaurants.  Breakfast was very expensive  $17 a person.  Discount on parking $ 7.50 vs $15. No one cleaned our room on the second day. Was told they were very busy.Emeryville is a nice quantity town but probably won't stay at this hotel again.

review.title: A Short Stay In Ca
review.reviewText: Was Good Management Cared. Breakfast was good.  Was Good Management Cared. Breakfast was good.  Was Good Management Cared. Breakfast was good.

review.title: Nice close to bay bridge

review.title: Convenient hotel close to UC Berkeley
review.reviewText: The staff was very pleasant and helpful.  The location was perfect, close to campus, freeway access and the Bay Bridge.  Coffee and tea was available in the mornings.  However, the hallway carpet on our floor was visibly dirty for the duration of our stay.  That means that no one ran a vacuum for three days.  We wondered what else wasn't clean there as well.

review.title: Confirmed reservation but no room!
review.reviewText:
Had a confirmed reservation from Expedia. Arrived about 11:30pm only to be told they had given my room away. I was peeved as you can imagine but the staff didn't care or apologize. Their counter was that they'd made a reservation at a hotel down the street. 

So we went to the other hotel only to find no reservation had been made. Hmmm. The guy at hotel 2 said it happens frequently. 

Rather than fight, we decided to go home. 

Ruined the evening of out wedding anniversary. 

Do NOT stay there

review.title: Good location

Shopping Plaza nearby,  convenient to shop and back to hotel 🏩.. Hotel staff nice and kind... The view of the room was gorgeous.. 

Enjoy this stay.

review.title: Excellence!!  With 5-star staff to boot!!!
review.reviewText: At just face value everything was wonderful...room, view, comfort, whirlpool, workout center, parking (w/in-out)...on top of that every time I needed something staff was over-the-top helpful to fulfill what I needing (including a bottle opener I would have never guessed they had on hand for guests!)  And of course Hilton's cookies...yum.  Could not have asked for anything better, thank you!
review.positiveRemarks: location, view, comfortable rooms, clean, STAFF!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing I can think of

review.title: Enjoyed my stay

Check in/out was easy and our room was clean (except for the food in the fridge, probably left behind by last guest). Towels were changed everyday and our bed were always made by the time we got back to our hotel room. Overall, very pleasant stay at the Hilton Garden Inn - would definitely recommend!

review.title: A little disappointing

We also were looking forward to using the Jacuzzi, but that wasn't even an option with the rust and broken tiles.  The bathrooms were not very clean either, but the size of the room was great and the staff were great as well.

review.title: Close to Berkeley and the Emeryville Market
review.reviewText: Room was clean and quiet.  We avoided paying for extras (except parking which we couldn't avoid.).   For example small snacks can be purchased at the gas station next to the parking lot. The location requires a car for most needs, yet, the location is convenient for visiting Oakland or Berkeley or SanFrancisco. We were satisfied with this hotel for this trip.

review.title: Our weekend stay
review.reviewText:
Upon arriving at our hotel we found out that our bay view room that we had reserved was no longer available.  Much to our disappointment, we were given a
view of the freeway instead.  However, the staff member that checked us in comped us with free parking and breakfast which we really appreciated.  The next day we were moved to a bay view room. Disappointed to find that the windows were filthy so the extra money for the bay view really wasn't worth it. Was surprised when making our reservations that the room had 2 full beds. Queen beds would have made for a more comfortable stay for our family of 4. Had opportunity to use the business center. Had up to date tech to handle all our needs. Overall, a good stay, a few improvements would have made it great.
review.positiveRemarks: Location of this hotel is great! So easy to hop on the freeway and get into San Francisco. And the shops and restaurants nearby are a huge plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace full beds with queen beds and clean the windows so guests can enjoy the view.
review.locationRemarks: Easy freeway access to San Francisco. Great restaurants, shops and movie theater nearby.

review.title: Easy access to SF and dinning
review.reviewText: This was our third use of this facility and again we enjoyed our stay.  The facility is comfortable and kept well.  We  are retired and the price and  'ease of use' are important for us.  Not only does the hotel meet our needs, there's attractive shopping and dinning within a few blocks.  The proximity to the Bay Bridge is appealing.  There are a number of historic and entertaining site near this location, i.e., Jack London Square (Oakland); Pier 39 (SF); and Rosie the Rivitor NP (Richmond).
review.positiveRemarks: The facility is comfortable and well kept.  We are retired, so price and ease of use are important to us.  The hotel meets our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing for us.
review.locationRemarks: There is attractive shopping and dining within a few blocks. There are special attractions in SF, Oakland, and Richmond.  The SF Bridge is close.

review.title: Good location

review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the useless compact car spots.  You end up just having people take up two spots and if not worrying about your car doors getting dinged up.

review.title: Hotel Staff should be lower level vs other hotels
review.reviewText: I asked hotel staff to bring nail cutter & opener, however they said that nail cutter is not available and I am required to go to bar to ask open.   I bought bottle of beer at front desk and it needs to be open by opener only.  Hotel should prepare the opener for their customer.   I have had good impression regarding Hilton Garden Inn based upon my experiences at other places, however I have been disappointed with this location at San Francisco.

review.title: Nice Locatiob

review.title: very bad experience

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText:
Staff was neither polite nor accomodating.  Would not grant a late check-out unless i was able to locate a loyalty acct number.  I definitely have one because i am incessantly barraged with their hhonors spam, but of course cant find the number.  I was also advised & assured that I had a zero balance upon check-in and check-out, but then they proceeded to charge me for the room four days after leaving, and added a 25 dollar "deposit" charge for each room.  Not sure what the hell a "deposit" charge is for... but i'm it's just a way to deceptively raise the rate for the room.

The location was the only thing pisitive... find another place to stay
Awesome staff! Super friendly, they had everything we needed.

review.title: Horrible Experience
review.reviewText: We were in town for a show at the Fox Theatre. Check in took over 30 minutes. We were stuck in parking lot because the parking arm wouldn't go up. I had to run bank to lobby in the pouring rain to get help. Then outer room key didn't work so another trip to the front desk. A car alarm went off all night so we didn't get any sleep. When I called the front desk they said they was nothing they could do. We should have driven home after show. We stayed in town because we were tired and wanted a good nights sleep, what an expensive mistake!

The area the hotel is in is nice, and it has a sizeable parking lot if you have a car, though the parking is extra.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level could be a little loud for some, as it's right next to I-580. The hotel offers earplugs, but I found turning on the room fan was enough.

review.title: College visit at CalBerkeley
review.reviewText: Front desk staff were very accommodating.  We asked for and were given very good information about the city, parking, directions, etc.  We were treated with respect, and never felt rushed.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  Room service was timely and delicious.
review.negativeRemarks: upgrade showers
review.locationRemarks: We rented a car, so we used our navigation system to visit places we had researched. CalBerkeley, hwy1, redwoods, several restaurants, pier39

review.reviewText:
At check in, we were told they didn't have the room we had booked available. However, he ended up finding something and gave us free parking and drinks for the night. The second day, we noticed a huge wet spot in our floor. It was quickly fixed and we were given a free breakfast card. The staff was great and attentive, making sure we got what we paid for. The view was perfect and it is only a couple miles from downtown San Francisco and other attractions. As we were checking out, we walked to the car to notice 4-5 cars with broken windows and some very angry people. Overall, we had a good experience even with all the mess ups, I can't say the same
For the people whose cars got broken in to!

The beds were uncomfortably, the pillows were so cheap that they flattened to the point where you might as well not have used a pillow at all. There is no bathroom fan so hope no one in your party needs to use the facilities for much otherwise you will not be able to air out the bathroom or the room. The housekeeping staff was rude when we asked for an extra sheet for the pull out couch (as it was taken but not replaced when the room had been cleaned that morning). It took two phone calls and an hour wait  to get the sheet and then the housekeeper told us that we needed to make sure we put it away before housekeeping cleaned the next day as the sheets were not replaced / changed everyday. As if that weren't enough then they were knocking on the door at 830 the next morning to clean the room stating we didn't have a do not disturb sign. Who is up and out of their room at 830 in the morning on a Saturday?! We were awake and getting ready to leave, but I have never experience this ANYWHERE else. To make matter worse, they charge an extra 15.00/day for parking!!!! Then the front desk is difficult to get a hold of requiring multiple phone calls or visits to have an issues addressed. We will not be staying here again.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to the fwy and several restaurants. Too bad such an accessable location doesn't have better quality.

review.title: The service that I have ever wanted
review.reviewText:
As a stranger to the town, Emeryville in Oakland California, I need help from the hotel that I chose to stay at. As I used to do so, I did ask "necessary" questions to deal with my daily affairs while staying in the area. 

The impression comes whenever I asked questions and even a small favor from the hotel staff. For example, I bought a pair of orranges but did not have any tools to eat with. Then came a person who brought a knife and a fork on a plate with him in 5-minute time window. Also I needed a bit of cardboard boxes to pack my stuff for shipping to my country. Then a hotel staff and a manager did volunteer to find boxes and the manager herself even brought several to my room. What an congenial hospitality. I was very impressed and then encouraged to finish arduous packaging. 

Although I have been a fan of Hilton Hotel brand for the past 30 years, I have not quite often met this kind of customized and beneficial help from the hotel. Thanks and I will stay again at other Hilton Hotel, too in other parts of the world. 

Best 
Jae Lee
review.negativeRemarks: Because the service at the hotel covers a wide range of areas, some parts need more and detailed explannation. But it is a bit OK for me.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping music records, LPs, and DVDs at record stores at Berkeley.

review.title: Best Views in the Bay

review.title: Hilton Garden Inn San Francisco/Oakland Bay Bridge
review.reviewText: Great location and close to everything. Room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: None

review.reviewText: Charging guests $30/night for parking in an unprotected lot outdoors seems ridiculous to me, especially when no one else would use that lot. Nearby shopping and restaurants have their own lots, with parking free or free once validated.

review.title: Will not be coming back
review.reviewText: The room setup was terrible and poorly decorated. No glass cups available. Nothing  in the fridge. The view was decent, but it still felt more like a cheap motel. Ive stayed at many Hilton hotels before, this one fell short of expectations.

review.title: OK, but other hotels in the area give better value
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nice, but there was a smokey smell in the room from the halls or venting system, especially on Saturday night.  Also, the bedding is slippery and the comforter kept falling off the bed.  Sheets too, were slippery and not comfortable.

Could provide free parking and free breakfast to give more value for the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is good.  Front desk people were friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: As above, more amenities like free parking, free breakfast and get different bedding.

review.title: Priced well near my family
review.reviewText: Always good service. Reception always friendly. We've stayed several times.

review.title: Comfortable, Staff willing to please
review.reviewText:
Overall?   Very comfortable / easy freeway accessibility / Nice waterfront location / Close to racetrack.  

However, we found the previous guest's leftovers in the mini-fridge--EEEW!!!!  Next, the hotel recently had bathrooms remodeled, so upon arrival from an outing, we found a plumber coming out of our room!  We were alarmed, because not only did we have the "do not disturb" sign on the door, but we were not notified that there would be anybody entering our room.  Was he a burglar?  I went to the Front Desk and the staff verified that the tubs and toilets needed caulking, but apologized profusely, as protocol had not been followed as to entering our room.  To make amends, they offered us a lovely room service dinner with cocktails, and comp'd our parking.  We were completely satisfied at this point! :)
review.negativeRemarks: The mini-fridge had someone else's food in it.  The floor could have been vacuumed better.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all Bay Area sights.  Nice waterfront with walking/biking path.

review.title: Front desk first class in manners and friendliness

review.positiveRemarks: Good quality in a quiet location

review.title: Convenient for us
review.reviewText: The hotel is very close to the Bay bridge, so it allows easy access to area locations. The hotel is very nice. The front desk staff were efficient and pleasant. The room was clean. The heater was just a bit noisy, but otherwise no complaints.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We decided to book last minute, since we had to be in San Francisco the next day so it was close. We arrived late evening, the hotel front desk was very nice and accommodating. The room was very nice and clean.  The con that I had was being woken up at 4:30am from a beeping sound from a vehicle and it lasted for about an hour.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and the Keurig is a plus!

review.reviewText: Pretty good place to stay in. Quick check in, good parking, clean and quiet rooms.

Our stay was comfortable. The location was great, close to stores and convenient to get to SFO. We were able to take a great long walk around the Marina. The hotel however does show some signs of age and could do with a facelift.

review.title: Excellent Hotel near San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel Near San Francisco easy access to the city, very friendly and helpful staff will definitely be back again

review.title: Nice stay, parking questionnable
review.reviewText:
Our stay was very pleasant..Amenities were excellent: wifi, bus office, gym, lobby fireplace,etc.
We were first a handicap room with a broken thermostat and no closet but got moved to a more adequate room. Nice space, beautiful view. Hotel is placed in great locale but to pay for parking and not have a shuttle that takes you to the airport. Overall satisfied.

The staff was especially helpful. We have stayed here before and will again, I'm sure. Very convenient
and reliable.

review.title: Convenient, close to highway
review.reviewText: Overall it's a very nice hotel. Very convenient: close to highway, and shopping. There are free coffee/ tea and cookies provided all day at the lobby. We stayed for 3 nights in total. The staffs are very friendly. The room is clean. However, it can be quite noisy since it's close to the highway. If you are a light sleeper it can be a problem, but it did not bother my sons. On the other hand, the hotel is very thoughtful by providing ear plugs, which is very helpful. I slept very well with my ear plugged. I ever brought the plugs with me for my stay in other hotels on this trip. I would say that we had a good stay in the hotel and will come back again if we ever going to visit the area again in the future.

review.title: My New Year's Eve.
review.reviewText: I have wonderfull eve to celebrate my New Year's Eve with my family in this Hotel. All staff are very friend from front desk to breakfast table.. Thank you for everything.
Good experience.  Would have been nice to have free parking and continental breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Could provide free parking and continental breakfast

review.reviewText: I had a nice stay, the receptionist kept calling me Ms. Edwards, I liked it. So professional. Parking was easy, nice room, very classy.  Nice decorations as well.

review.title: Hotel charges close to 5 Star rates but is 3 star
review.reviewText:
The expectation of a fully operational Business center is reasonable. But the large copy machine does not allow for scanned business documents to be emailed directly AND there was no alternative USB port for a Flash Drive memory stick to save the scans.

I stayed here with the express purpose of sorting files for scan and email delivery.

The staff however were VERY friendly, helpful and efficient... however, the bell service for checkout was not available as they appeared to be short staffed.

This is not a good look for Hilton, a Brand that I have come to regard highly as an international traveler of over 40 years.
review.positiveRemarks:
The staff however were VERY friendly, helpful and efficient...

The location is great for SF Bay Area maneuvering ...

It was VERY clean and tidy
review.negativeRemarks: The business center must allow for scanned documents to be emailed directly from the scanner.

review.negativeRemarks: $15.00/dy. for parking.

review.reviewText: Wonder hotel and location. Extremely well kept up looking gorgeous. Awesome staff with excellent customer service. Bar is great.

It was a great location with beautiful view of the Bay area...

Love it!

Great place to stay. Love the kind staff and comfortable bed.

My stay at the hotel was very overwhelming. From the first day the I check in the staff were welcoming and polite. The room was very clean minus the windows. I had a beautiful ocean view looking towards San Francisco.

review.title: SF hotels were superpricey that weekend
review.reviewText: So we decided to stay in Emeryville. The cheapest decent place in SF was $249 + $50/day for parking. Garden Inn was $199 + I think $20.day. And it wasn't far from anything. Clean hotel, easy to get around with a car at least. Jeremy at the front desk was extra helpful.

review.title: Hotel needs improvement
review.reviewText:
Room Cleaning_ garbage cans remove, bathroom surfaces wiped, not cleaned.  I had empty coffee cups left in the room.
Other service staff - friendly, helpful
Manager - rude, no service friendly behavior.  
Expedia sign up - When I made my reservation, I made a mistake and put in the wrong date for the end of my stay. My travel dates were 11/6-11/9.  I tried to correct it on line, but each time that I tried to do that, the price changed, so I thought I would make the change when I arrived at the hotel  The desk clerk changed my last day to 11/10 when I checked in.  However, on the 9th, I received a call from the Desk Manager early afternoon while I was out on the other side of Oakland saying that I needed to return to the hotel since my checkout was for that day.  I told him that I had changed my checkout date to the 10th and he told me if I wanted to stay another night the price would change to $189.  I told him that I had made arrangements when I arrived to extend my stay and the clerk at that time did not say there would be a change in the price for the last night or I would have made other arrangements at that time.  He told me that if I was unwilling to pay the $189 I needed to come and get my things now. I came back to the hotel and was turning in my key card to the desk clerk and he was confused because on the computer he could see that I was not scheduled to leave until the 10th.  He call another desk personnel over and they found out that I had 2 entries.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to my family
review.negativeRemarks: Improved customer service
review.locationRemarks: It was good for shopping and food

review.title: Nice hotel close to freeway

review.title: SF visit
review.reviewText: grest stay we have stayed at this place while they were remodeling and they did a great job.

review.reviewText: My fiancé and I had a great getaway. We took a walk by the bay, visited the Bay Street Mall, and took an Uber to SF. Everything was so close. The person who checked us in was unable to give us a bay facing room, so she gave us complimentary breakfast and parking. It was definitely a great experience.

review.title: It's ok, expected a little more from Hilton
review.reviewText: Check in took longer than it should have even though I had a confirmation number.  The hills side room was noisy, you can hear the traffic pretty well considering the hotel is next to the freeway, they do provide ear plugs, but I personally don't like sleeping with earplugs in.  Air conditioner was broken so we had to use the manual system which was also noisy.  I was looking forward to the view from the 11th floor, but the windows were super dirty so I couldn't really enjoy it.  The location is great, close to everything.  Parking is a little expensive at $15 a day.  Bed was comfortable and room was clean. The gym is clean and hottub looked nice.

review.title: It was a good place will book here again
review.reviewText: It was awesome thank you just parking was a hassle
Staff was very nice, rooms were clean, beds very comfortable!

review.title: Room with a view
review.reviewText: Amazing view.  Quiet room.  The only thing I would of liked improved would be the window washed for the view, still amazing, but could of been even better.

review.title: Nice!
review.reviewText: Got this hotel last minute for a trip to SanFrancisco.  Couldn't afford places over in SanFran and this was just a quick trip across the bridge.  The room was very clean.  The staff was friendly.  They do charge for parking and no included breakfast though there is complimentary coffee.  Their breakfast buffet was $15/person but there is a Dennys and IHOP close so you have other options.  The beds were very hard though.  Like, sheets over plywood hard, so I woke up stiff and miserable.  Regardless, I would probably book there again just because hotels kind of gross me out but this was clean and nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were awfully hard.  Hate paying for parking at a hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaraunt options.  Short drive over to SanFran downtown and wharfs.

review.title: Nice hotel with chatty staff and lots of smoking
review.reviewText:
I stood at the desk for 2-3 minutes while a manager chatted with a staff member rather than checking me in. I finally turned to one of the other two staff members standing there doing nothing and asked if anyone would be willing to check me in. The middle staff member said yes, so I scooted in front of her station. The manager then apologized that yes, she was just chatting and should have checked me in.

My room was near the end of the hall, which had a sign that said "fire door - keep closed." Instead, the door was propped open for the entire stay. One night, I called the front desk to report two guests smoking on the stairs outside the propped open fire door. They said they would send someone up, but nobody came.

If you're ok with fire risk, the smell of smoke in your room, and negligent staff, I would highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.
review.locationRemarks: There's a Denny's under the freeway...

review.title: Filthy windows with an upgraded expensive bay view
review.reviewText: Broken air in room. Filthy windows of upgraded bay view room. Dirty bedding that smelled horrible. Room service took 30 minutes to answer the phone then brought the wrong food.

review.title: Nice hotel with few flaws
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was fantastic! We were very comfortable and felt very safe. The staff were extremely helpful and wonderful. The only thing I could say about this hotel is it's a bummer that you have to pay for parking, there is no pool, and continental breakfast is not included. But the breakfast that was available was amazing! Kids ate for free! And there was more than enough food.  We would definitely come again! Especially because it's literally right off the bay bridge and very short commute to downtown San Francisco

review.title: Nice hotel with great view.
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel next to Berkeley Marina.  The room felt clean and inviting.  The bed was very comfortable, and the linens were soft and clean.  I would definitely recommend to a friend.
review.negativeRemarks: The person that checked us in was not very friendly, but competent.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is next to Berkeley Marina and has a great walking/biking trail that wraps around the marina.  Beautiful!

review.title: Nice place to stay,very comfortable
review.reviewText:
Very good experience 
Enjoyed are stay, would recommend to friends

review.title: "All that and some Wine"
review.reviewText:
I had an amazingly wonderfully blessed fun safe trip. I was blessed with celebrating my 55th birthday in this amazing city. When I reached my hotel I was greeted with birthday greetings as well as a free b'fast coupon. I had a great meal at the hotel restaurant, with a complimentary glass of wine.

My room was nice and spacious, clean and the beds and pillows were wonderful. I am a pillow snob, but enjoyed my four nights of rest there. 

I have absolutely no complaints with the hotel, my trip or my shuttle service.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked everything about this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I could see at this time that needs improving.
review.locationRemarks: I was able to walk to the Plaza, caught the Emery Go Round daily to go to the Bart to get into San Francisco.

review.title: sucks
review.reviewText: They messed up my room the first night, not only that someone opened my room door around 3am.   That was a crazy, good thing I locked the latch before I went to bed.

review.title: Noise
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed with all the traffic noise it sounds like a racetrack could not sleep very good at all

review.title: dis-honorous ad
review.reviewText: bay view rooms ended up with roof view rooms！misleading ad。

review.title: parking
review.reviewText: I would give this a hotel a higher rating but they charge for their parking and that was never mentioned clearly by Expedia. I'm not a heavy traveler so maybe that is normal for that area but its the first time I've ever been charged for parking $15.00 per night.
review.negativeRemarks: Include parking in the price or at least make sure customer is clear about the fees
review.locationRemarks: Dont get lost!! Very bad areas immediately around it and if you get lost at night, well good luck on that!  Plan your trip!! bring cash for tolls!

review.title: Nice , clean the view of the SF bridge is great.
review.reviewText: Nothing bad to say ,hotel was what I expected. Would stay again

review.title: Very nice hotel, great spot!
review.reviewText:
We loved our stay, thankyou! Nice clean hotel with super comfortable beds!  Great location for touring the bay area!  

We will stay here again if in the area!

review.title: The outside windows
review.reviewText: The view was nice but I could barely see it do to the windows being so dirty. I book with this hotel just for the city view and I couldn't even see it.

review.title: Great hotel with a great price. Great location
review.reviewText: Akira was wonderful at check-in! Our room was clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was good, and our server Pako was very pleasant. Overall a great hotel.

review.title: Cal Game Hotel
review.reviewText: The HGI is always my first choice to stay for Cal Football Games.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything and the cookies are a nice touch!
review.negativeRemarks: No improvement necessary.
review.locationRemarks: It's on the water and walking distance to shopping and dining.

review.title: Hotel Parking cost money
review.reviewText: They have their own parking space and they charge for parking!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge for the parking, this is ridiculous!

review.title: Easy access to San Francisco,  but problems.
review.reviewText:
Check-in was easy and the room was clean and easy driving access to SF. 

 However the whole hotel is suppose to be non-smoking, but  guests were smoking in the stairwell and in their rooms. When I spoke to the staff, she said there is nothing they can do, they will fine them. Our room smelled like cigarettes, not good.
Only one of three elevators were working and the hotel was packed and when one finally arrived, there was no room to get on. We ended up walking down 7 flights with our luggage and the stairway was locked from outside so there was no access back. 
Luis did save the day by comping my room, but this hotel needs to be better managed.

review.title: Good experienced
review.reviewText: It is fair price...ok to stay here...close to shop...we enjoy staying..going back here

review.title: Nice hotel near Oakland/SF, but parking charge
review.reviewText: Nice hotel near/on bay.  Close to Oakland, San Francisco, and highways, and in nicer area, but be aware most of the bay area near SF has a lot of homeless.   Newish, clean and one could tell the staff was trying hard to please.  I would definitely stay here again.  On the down side... Was not told that there was a $15/day parking fee until I arrived.  While not unusual in a downtown hotel, this was not downtown and was not mentioned until we arrived.  In addition, since I was there to visit my child, their car could not be driven to visit us without a parking fee unless she stayed less than 20 minutes (the complimentary maximum time), since there was no other parking in the area.   Stayed in a double room and it was a little cramped, particularly around the desk.   While the hotel was not cheap, it was one of the more reasonably priced, although the websites had one price in the adds and the actual multi-night price was higher in that the low price (in the adds) listed was wrong on the website and then the price did not apply for all nights of the stay, ie, some nights were much higher.  Obviously the prices shown at the time of booking were correct, other than the parking and taxes were not added.
review.positiveRemarks: It is a nice hotel and was one of the better priced nice hotels in the area.  Being on the bay was a plus. Refrig, microwave, coffee, also a plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Add accuracy, note parking charge, and relocate desk to avoid bed.
review.locationRemarks: Not for from Berkley, or SF.

review.title: Bang for your buck
review.reviewText: The type of hotel I'd like to stay at whenever I travel.  Excellent service, warm staff, clean rooms, clean  grounds, and lovely lounge and lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: Its warm and courteous staff. The cleanliness of the hotel from its lobby to the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to the major freeways, eateries, and shopping

review.reviewText: Very good experience, the staff is extremely nice.
satisfactory for a brief one night stay, convenient to the Bay Bridge for an early morning event in SF

review.title: noisy
review.reviewText:
I asked front desk to put me in a quiet room put me next to the frwy and car wash huh? 
hard to sleep in on my vaca. 
had to ask several times to get a set of clean towels 
the bar grill in the hotel did not clean their area - dirty glasses were left out and food was on the carpet in the lounging  area that I saw the night before. 
I told the staff didn't seem to care. 
charging to park at the hotel seemed a bit ridiculous 
the only thing I like about the hotel is inexpensive and location was convenient

photos.caption: This is the view from my room

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: We came to San Francisco for one day and decided to stay by the Bay and this Hotel was our first choice excellent experience we love the location with awesome view and the drive thru the Oakland bridge was fantastic. We will stay again and again at this Hotel.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, amazing staff, and a great view
review.reviewText: This hotel has THE best staff I've ever encountered (from the front desk to the pool service guy). Everyone was friendly, pleasant, had amazing customer service skills, surprisingly interactive and sweet with our 6 and 1 year old children, and I could keep going on and on. Our room was super clean, spacious, and had a great view. The breakfast in the morning was good too. This hotel is  perfect and close to San Francisco. You won't regret booking here.
It's a nice hotel, I loved it. It has a really nice view.

review.title: Great view of the Bay
review.reviewText: Wonderful the staff were very friendly will stay here again.

review.title: Feel like home.
review.reviewText: We had a King suite which is like two rooms.  My kids like it a lot.  Breakfast is buffet.  We are Hilton Platinum member which we enjoyed parking right next to the entrance and also free breakfast.  The hotel is clean and the bed is comfort.  The shower is good.  It's quiet at night which we can sleep well.  People are nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't like the parking is expensive.  $15  dollars per day.  The hotel is NOT new.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants and malls are close by.  Close to Berkerley University as well.  Close to Bay Bridge to SF.  Everywhere is only about 15 to 25 min drives.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed for business. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms were nice as well as clean. Parking is close and safe. Nice hotel.

review.title: Convenient, Clean & Comfortable
review.reviewText: I was greeted with a complimentary Manager's Reception where they were BBQ'ing and provided Beer, Wine & Sodas for guests to enjoy-great way to start! All of the staff was friendly and helpful and the room was spacious, clean and very comfortable.

review.title: I was awake all night long!
review.reviewText:
This is my first feedback ever!!!! 
Although they have nice rooms and good staff but the place is located in a horrible area! West wing of the Hotel is next to a automatic 24h Car wash working nonstop! and the car wash is next to a Shell Gas station! Too much noise! I was up all night long!! and in the morning when I told them about this, they respond was...YOUR PARKING IS ON US!! when I paid $200+. If you MUST stay in this hotel, do not accept rooms next to the gas station.
review.negativeRemarks: I do not think they can move the Car wash and gas station away!

review.title: Great hotel, great staff!
review.reviewText: Loved every moment! Staff was amazing, rooms were amazing, hotel was amazing. All and all great trip for my family and myself. I would definitely recommend.

Excellent view from the room. We booked a bay-view room which was on the 12th floor. From there you could see the whole bay view as well as the beautiful sunset. If you drive pass the hotel entrance and keep driving till the end, there is a nice little waterfront park where you could enjoy sunset and the view of SF. And there is also a nice Hong Kong restaurant with great view and food (can be a little pricy though). 

We had a king room, clean, good view, amenities are new, but the room is smaller than we would expect. It would be better if it is more spacious.

review.title: Disappointed the second time around
review.reviewText: This was my second stay here and I returned because my first experience was a positive one. This time around the staff was excellent, personable and professional, but the bathroom was not clean. The  floor was dirty, sink was stopped up and there was a long hair that was not mine in the tub.
Overall a pretty great experience! Just had a little problem checking in but hotel offered  free breakfast So they did resolve problem very quickly.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in
review.locationRemarks: Shopping

photos.caption: Marina with restaurants less than a mile walk

review.title: Nice hotel on the Bay, convenient to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed here as a moderately priced alternative to San Francisco. There is a free shuttle that takes people to the BART station. Now I wouldn't stay anywhere else! The room had a splendid view of the bay. I had my morning walk along the bay and saw heron and seals. It was just so pleasant.

review.title: Close to the city
review.reviewText: Fast check in. Nice helpful staff. Convenient location.
It is a great hotel for the price. They charge $15 for parking with in/out privilege.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Everything was great I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It was clean the staff were polite it was great

review.title: Well located hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: We like this Hilton because it's in a good location in the Bay Area.  Easy to get to SF and the East Bay, but at a reasonable price.  I like to walk along the Emeryville Marina or Shorline Park in the mornings.

review.title: Very nice!!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, beautifull room and view.  Good staff. Its really close to the Bart Station so thats perfect if you dont have car. They have a shuttle to the station.

review.title: Far away from Central San framcisco
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel on the whole. Only main issues is travelling to main San Francisco is tricky as you have to catch free bus. Walk a distance and then Bart it over. If you're not happy to do this then there's very little to do in the area.
Clean hotel, helpful staff , not much of a menu to chose from if hungry . Pleasant enough
We had a good stay at this hotel except for the staring from one of the staff behind the counter. It was very uncomfortable.

review.title: Convenient to Oakland and San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Check in was efficient and the room was lovely.  

I was surprised and disappointed that the hotel wouldn't  accommodate our need for a later checkout time.  We'd come from New York to visit our daughter and grandson in Oakland for a 4 day stay and needed to check out at 2 PM rather than 12 PM.  I was shocked by the abrupt, "NO. Checkout time is at 12" without any concern for our need for a bit more time.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very comfortable especially the bed and bath linens. The view of the mountains was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: More flexibility in checkout and concern with the need for accommodation.
review.locationRemarks: It's convenient to everything in the surrounding areas. We drove up CA 1 to Plantation, Stinson Beach and Muir Woods.  We also visited San Francisco.

review.title: Overbooked and screwed
review.reviewText: I've worked at a hotel for five years and in my experience when a hotel screws up they try to help you find another hotel. Boy was I wrong. They were oversold and they took no responsibility whatsoever. They simply said contact Expedia and it was entirely their fault. so Thanks Hilton for absolutely nothing!
review.negativeRemarks: They could learn how to oversell their hotel

review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and the hotel was very clean
This was my husband and my fourth time staying at this hotel.  We enjoy it each and every time, this is the only hotel we will stay at when visiting the bay area.

review.title: Overall great stay
review.reviewText:
Only bad thing was that someone was allowed to bill food to our room from the dining room and it was not us.
We had a hard time to get it removed.
I asked to see the dining room manger and a receipt with a signature.
It did get removed but there should be a better system when billing to rooms by using a room number only.
But we will definitely come back as overall nice place.

review.title: 2nd Review...
review.reviewText: The Traffic issues to San Francisco is why I would give the hotel a 3 star and not 4 star.  As is this is a very nice place to stay, but if you are taking advantage of the pricing vs San Francisco hotels just plan 1 1/2 to 2 hours to et into the city, but coming back to the hotel was never an issue.  Personally I saved over $600 staying here and I accept the trade in time and dollars.  While the traffic is not the fault of the hotel you still need to take it into consideration, while rating this property.

When I booked through Expedia I was given a room the size of a closet right next to the elevators. The view outside my window was a roof top with all of the airconditioning units for the hotel. The sound of this was horrendous, I seriously felt as if I were on an airplane the whole night. I couldn't sleep at all. I should have complained to the staff but I was so tired from a very busy day and I just wanted to go to sleep. I did let the hotel staff know about my experience in the morning. They told me since I prepaid through Expedia there was nothing they could do but to make sure I am taken care of on my next trip. I returned soon after and gave them another try they put me I a beautiful room with a view of the San Francisco Bay.... I guess it all depends. This hotel can be fantastic or not so much.

review.title: Nice stay. Great location.
review.reviewText:
Great location. Nice rooms. Friendly staff. Very clean 
Great view of the bay. 

Breakfast not included. 15.00 per person buffet not kept stocked. 
Parking not included 15.00 per day

review.title: Trip to relax
review.reviewText: I took my wife to relax in the Bay Area and visit family, and we really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Hotel.  Our check-in was smooth and quick which only took us two minutes and the staff was very helpful.  We received a complementary bag of snacks and water which we used for your city venture.  Our room was very clean and comfortable, but the pillows were not like they use to be but we made the best of it and enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location and easy access to the Freeway and surrounding cities.
review.negativeRemarks: change the pillows out they were not comfortable
review.locationRemarks: we visited Emeryville Bay Street mall, then took a ferry boat ride from Jack London Square to San Francisco.

review.title: Great place to stay! Love it!
review.reviewText: Spent a week there. Super clean and comfortable beds. Service and staff is great. They go above and beyond their role to help you. Cookies they put out in the afternoons - so delicious- you cannot find in stores. Definitely will stay again there. Great view of the bay from room.

review.title: Staff was nice
review.reviewText:
Check in was fast..
Parking not overly expensive..
Room was clean
I would stay there again

review.title: No breakfast included
review.reviewText: No included breakfast but coffee all day & cookies in the afternoon
review.negativeRemarks: Softer bed. Complimentary breakfast and the room was small.
review.locationRemarks: That was great. San Francisco took just a quick trip across the bay bridge. Entrance right there.

review.title: Very comfortable, quiet area
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel right off the highway, but quiet - you can't hear the traffic. The room was very comfortable and clean. Checking in was easy and the staff was friendly. The hotel is situated in a nice spot. You can go for a walk by the water and enjoy the view.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText:
Stayed at this hotel on a road trip north across California and stopped to see San Fransisco. This was located on the Oakland side but next to the bay and close to the bridge across to San Fran. Both the hotel and the room was excellent and very well maintained. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. There was free high speed wifi which was great. The room was spacious and very nice with great modern decor and layout.
Felt a little corporate like a standard hotel they would give to business travellers on business, which is a good thing because it felt semi-luxury for its price point. Nice hotels in downtown San Fransisco can get crazy expensive depending on the time of year. It was great overall with plenty of parking and i had no complaints.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: it is a very nice hotel and has a great location, nice personnel, good service, great support, good food, clean, close to busineses and airport
Arianna at the front desk was the most helpful and patient.  Took time to help answer all of our questions.
Room was clean, staff was friendly, check in was quick and simple. Came for a concert to the Greek Theatre (its about 15 mins away)
It looks like a nice hotel but the installations are old, no room to put anything in the bathroom and the chair we got was disgusting; The bar is nice and the restaurant is good.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms and bathroom facilities
review.locationRemarks: Nice shopping center 3 mins from there

review.title: Easily accesible, close to O.co Coliseum
review.reviewText: Nothing special but nothing wrong with this hotel.

review.title: Love the tropical look carpet!
review.reviewText: Just passing through for one night.  The only thing missing was breakfast.  Very nice stay perfect location.  Very helpful staff.

review.title: What a pleasant surprise!
review.reviewText:
The room rate was very affordable for the area! I was surprised to see such high quality in every aspect. There was two entrances made into my room day of check out though. Too eager to get me out of there I guess. Food was incredible, room service very efficient, and shower was top notch. $15 a day for parking is my biggest complaint. Oh, also check out is at noon !!! Score :) 

P.S. Breakfast buffet is a must have!

review.title: Nothing fancy but comfortable
review.reviewText: Great bay view and comfortable bed. The only slight drawback is its location; I have to go across a few blocks to shop.

review.title: Really nice hotel , great location
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel. The decor is so nice and the rooms are clean and modern. The staff is also very friendly and helpful. I had no issues at all.

review.title: Nice hotel close to shopping
review.reviewText: Nice hotel stayed here before. Close to two major cities(Oakland and San Fran).  Best of both worlds

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Very clean. Very comfortable. Great customer service.

review.title: Hotel is very nice with beautiful views of the bay
review.reviewText: Breakfast buffet. $reasonable;cookies served in the afternoon;cozy fireplaces enhance  2 of the sitting areas which we used;coffee is available all day free

review.title: Convenient hotel close to Berkeley
review.reviewText: Stayed overnight with my daughter, visited Berkely (UCB).
review.positiveRemarks: Really enjoyed the cotton sheets, lovely pillows!
review.negativeRemarks: Tell people about parking charge and no breakfast included in special price!
review.locationRemarks: Berkeley was fascinating to an old sixties rebel!

review.title: Clean, well run and conveniently located.
review.reviewText: Hotel was fully booked but all ran well.  Parking at check-in is confusing as there is little space to park in the entryway and people are driving every which way.

review.title: Filthy windows negate view of bay
review.reviewText: Dirty windows and small beds. Former Holiday Inn and still belongs in that hotel class.
it's okay....   I liked the restaurant being in the same building and the staff were nice....   not very good views of the bay ....   nice of them to provide ear plugs...

review.title: Well priced but lnconvenient access to SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was very well priced with cheap parking at 15$ a day. It was very noisy as it is located next to a freeway. Lots of traffic and ambulances starting before 6 each morning. The hotel itself is nice - classic Hilton. My room was great with a mini fridge and microwave. The bathroom could have been cleaner - there was hair in the floor that I had to clean myself. Hairdryer very low power.  We drove into San Fran each day as the hotel is 3 miles away from BART. Parking wasn't too bad in SF - 30$ Max at a lot of garages.

review.title: Memorial weekend
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location,friendly staff. Close to shops and restaurants. It would be great if they have free breakfast.

review.title: I left early
review.reviewText:
The hotel, like most hotels in the Bay Area was old and dirty. The food was terrible and I couldn't sleep on my miserable mattress.
I'm glad that there was a bar.
After three days in that box, I left and went to a marriott.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything except for the staff.
review.locationRemarks: Drive to the city, do nothing in that area!

review.title: Nice hotel close to beach
review.reviewText: Nice staffs and excellent service with good condition room

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Great stay. Went for a local EDM event and was impressed by the facility and quality of the establishment that Hilton Garden Inn in Emeryville, CA had to offer.
review.negativeRemarks: One of the female bartenders let someone watch the Fast and Furious 6 instead of any of the sport games that were taking place and turned up the sound
review.locationRemarks: YOU CAN DO ANYTHING in the Bay Area. (Except snow sports.) In very close proximity however there is plenty of shopping, good food, and IKEA.

review.title: Train ride away
review.reviewText: Loved it, great staff close train station from the hotel. Train ride away from San Francisco.

review.title: Reasonable choice in Emeryville
review.reviewText: This was our second time staying here, mostly because of its location close to Berkeley, and the SF Bridge. It is well-appointed, and the rooms fine. But the lack of a free breakfast is a major negative when almost all similar hotels provide (there are no nearby food options other than the hotel restaurant.)  in short, it's OK, but not a first choice in future.

review.title: Noisy hotel at a business district
review.reviewText: The hotel is located right next to an 8 lane freeway, making it noisy day and night. As a matter and fact, a "complementary" pair of ear plugs is provided in the room. The noise would have been less if they had invested in some dual pane windows, but i guess providing ear plugs to guests are cheaper. I guess expedia had this on sale for a reason.
Put parents here for UC berkeley graduation and it was suitable for their needs.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean room in timely manner - we were out the whole morning but when got back at 4 the room was not done yet.
review.locationRemarks: Closeby to food/shopping area

review.title: Nice place and close to train and shopping.
review.reviewText: We had a great stay. Ancira was behind the desk and was friendly and very helpful.

review.title: Fine for a short stay
review.reviewText: This is a good experience for the money.  The room is clean, the staff is friendly. There is some highway noise, but its acceptable.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been nice to know that parking is an extra $15 per day and not included in the hotel rate.
review.locationRemarks: Berkeley

review.title: Great service, horrible room
review.reviewText: This has to be the worst airport hotel I've ever stayed in my life. I got nothing to complain about the service, but the room is absolutely horrible. I got a room in the lower level, and it smelled like someone died in there. The bathroom is very tiny; I can't find a place to put my cleanser and cosmetics. The bed is uncomfortable too. however, all th staff who helped me there were really nice.

review.title: Nice hotel close to BART
review.reviewText: Hotel room was super clean although it was a bit small. The staff were very friendly and went above and beyond to provide a positive experience. Hotel is close to a BART station and there is a free shuttle that picks you up and drops you off at the BART. Hotel is also close to a large outdoor mall in Emeryville.

Very good and comfy rooms. 
Value per money on breakfast is not so good. 
The food in the bar is very good and they serve until 2200. 
I had not good experience with eh reception staff about a package i ordered.

review.title: No noise policy
review.reviewText: Spent 3 night there for my anniversery. Pretty veiws, most of the staff very friendy. However we had two friends visiting us and we were just talking and laughing. They came to our door and asked us to quite down. Then two minute later call and said we were still to loud.  They threaten to call police. Mind you that you can hear every elivater, door, toilet, and voice from every room near us. There is a two inch gap at the bottom of the door. I had to go to the lobby to talk to my guest. Didnt help the hotel staff changed his story 3 time by the time i asked to speak to a manager. They need something to inprove the noise coming under the door and threw the walls. they could have just offered us a place we could hang out and visit with our company. They handle the situation poorly. They manager could even appoligize for the way i was talked to by staff.

review.title: Feels like one is on an island
review.reviewText: The hotel is a good walk from any restaurants but there is a shell station within 100 feet of the hotel. We thought we booked for a queen bed, the bed was very small. It definitely looked like a full size. One of the front desk staff when I asked did say that it was, the next day, a different staff member said absolutely it is a queen, not so! Was very disappointed in that. We had been to the Hikton garden inn in Hollywood, Ca, just the week before, big queen bed, that was great, but not this one.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was ok, not top notch by any means, the bed was not a good size
review.locationRemarks: You must have a car or you have to rely on Taxi's

review.negativeRemarks: The size of the rooms were pretty small.
review.locationRemarks: Denny's is across the street. You can't beat that.

review.reviewText: I hate these place because I ordered upper  room and they give me  lower room and when I arrived the room wasn't ready

review.title: a bit worn
review.reviewText:
The rooms need some refreshing.  There is a faint musty smell and things just look a bit worn.

For the rooms that face west, there is little sound insulation, so you get the droning sound of the freeway nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: see above

review.title: Fantastic view.
review.reviewText:
This place is very convenient to the bridge, and has a surprisingly lovely trail to walk along the shore. Also, if you're there on the weekend, it's worth the 25 minute walk to an excellent dim sum restaurant at the end of the point.
I was, however, disappointed that they charge for parking at the hotel. Come on.
review.positiveRemarks: View from rooms. Spacious. Pleasant lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff aren't the brightest and best you'll ever see.

review.reviewText: This hotel is a great property with fair lodging price.

review.title: Hotel is in trafficy area.

review.title: Ok hotel

review.title: Good value for San Fran if you have a car

Breakfast offered healthy food options and was good value

review.title: Close access to freeway, bike trail, n markets
review.reviewText: Impressed with the quality of the room, friendliness of the staff, ease of access to freeways, bike trails, n grocery stores. Bay view room provides beautiful day & night view of the SF/Oakland bay bridge area.

review.title: Convenient location next to Bay Bridge
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with nice 10th floor Bay view of San Francisco and nice staff. Remarkably noisy location with freeway and local noise (free earplugs come with the room) and may be some construction going on? I had an "accessible" room with accessible bath that had no place for razor, place for soap or shampoo in the shower space and a tiny space (without vanity) for shaving/hygiene supplies where things easily could fall of onto floor like my toothbrush! The handle of the blow dryer and the key pad on the phone were ripe with (crusty) residue that looked unsanitary. The toilet  apparently leaked since the tank filled routinely. My most (unusual) disappointing stay at a Hilton property to date.
review.negativeRemarks: Insure items that guest handle or touch are clean without any obvious disgusting residue.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to Amtrak, Lake Merit, Jack London Square and next to the Bay Bridge with easy access to S.F. or Tiburon area, Marin County.

review.title: It was loud and they had ear plugs by the bed..
review.reviewText: At this price point I should not have to use ear plugs to try and sleep... Single pane windows equal freeway noise. They say sounds of the bay.. no sounds of traffic 24/7
review.positiveRemarks: Resturant was good and a decent value.
review.negativeRemarks: Dual sound windows for freeway facing rooms!

review.reviewText: Nice view of the Bay. Couldn't see the Golden Gate Bridge, but there was a nice view of the Bay Bridge and The City from our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary breakfast would be nice.

review.title: Convenient hotel, if you have a car
review.reviewText:
Convenient hotel, but don't expect to walk anywhere from there.

If you plan to have a car a drive around the various Bay Area sights (San Francisco, Berkeley, Marin County...) then this place is well located. If you are only interested in Downtown San Francisco, then this is maybe not the most practical place to stay at.

Parking is $15 per day.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel has everything you would expect from a Hilton Garden Inn type of hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was smallish. I was expecting two Queen beds but got two Doubles.

review.title: Nice hotel but no extras

not to far from University California, Berkeley
review.positiveRemarks: it was nice to walk in and get a cup of refeshing water
review.negativeRemarks: give the outside a facelift ie paint.

review.title: nice location

review.title: Great location & Views
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location, close to the freeway and restaurants. Downtown Berkely is close by and there is so much to do and see. Parking is pricey at $15 a day but, this is the norm for the area. Because California is going through a drought the water pressure is non-existent. We had a beautiful view of the bay. The only negative is that the walls are thin and if you have a noisy neighbor at night it can be annoying.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure and thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: Starbucks and black bear diner for breakfast.

review.title: Will visit again!

Horrible personal at this hotel I would never stay with them again

review.reviewText: The manager is rude and unsupportive and addressing your concerns. Also they charge $15 a day for parking and you can take almost 30 minutes to 45 minutes before you're able to find a parking.

review.negativeRemarks: The bed was a little hard.  Maybe a mattress pad could be included.

review.reviewText: Check-in was hassle free. Parking at night gets crowded. Room was clean. Close to multiple entertainment venues.

Very nice! Would definitely stay thete again. Super clean, helpful staff, and comfy rooms.

review.reviewText: My stay was enjoyable at the Hilton.  The room was clean and well maintained by housekeeping while I was there.  I enjoyed the food service in the evening.  I did not want a buffet breakfast in the morning so I skipped that.  Overall the staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel

review.title: Easy check in very clean
review.reviewText:
Lounge was nice and staff were accommodating.  Unfortunately the fridge in the room made horrible noises all night and the blanket was only the width of the bed so my husband & I wrestled for it :)
Room was clean and very nice though.
We weren't aware that parking would be extra!
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to freeway system.  Nice clean room.  Pool & Jacuzzi (didn't use them though.)  Maybe next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger blanket on the bed and quiet fridge :)
review.locationRemarks: Close to Berkeley and pretty easy to get there. Went to visit our son who attends there.

review.title: Hilton Garden Inn in Emeryville Experience
review.reviewText:
Not bad but not great!  Room was across from elevator 2nd floor so between the elevator ping, the train noise and the parking lot noise, not a very good nights sleep.  The "buffet" breakfast for $14.95 was terrible terrible terrible.  At 7:00 am you would think the food would be warm it was not!  The pastries seemed like they were left over from the day before as they were exceptionally dry.

Also when I asked about shuttle service I was told that they don't offer it on the weekends only Mon-Thursday.  Hello, so they don't cater to the weekend travelers only the business people during the week.  Not good.
review.negativeRemarks: You could provide shuttle service all the time.  You could REALLY improve on the food.
review.locationRemarks: NA

review.reviewText: Great hotel with better staff.... good view and very affordable.... plenty of shopping and fun stuff nearby....

review.title: Nice room
review.reviewText: Front desk not very accommodating.  We wanted a bay view front desk said no!  We were celebrating our 39 th year.  I would not stay there again.  First place that offered ear plugs!
Overall, it was a good experience. I wish the gym was a little bit larger

review.title: Nice view of the bay
review.reviewText: Another example of upper management not really caring about proper staffing. Although they were extremely nice, the hotel staff seemed a bit overwhelmed during check-in. A lot of chaos was going on like a visiting upper management type with his family that kept sort of butting in while the short staffed front desk team were trying to take care of paying customers. Plus an annoying cab driver kept standing around making noise because he needed some change from the busy front desk. It seemed like something out of a Marx Brothers movie because then some guy left his hotel card key,  i.d., wedding presents, and other stuff in his room and needed to get back into his room so it was pandemonium just to get him squared away. The view of the bay was awesome but the room was right next to the elevator and although the front desk clerk said I wouldn't hear a thing, it was loud and annoying. Plus the crack under the door was so big that a lot of light came into the room at night. If you're staying for one night, it is okay but I wouldn't stay longer than that.
review.positiveRemarks: The view. The front desk staff was nice.
review.locationRemarks: Nice view of the bay but still kinda far from things. Nothing really within walking distance. It's just kind of a place to stop, shower, and sleep.

review.title: Hilton changed their policy so we couldn't stay
review.reviewText: Booking the hotel on Expedia no notification of their policy changing the age limit to 21 was not on there. When we arrived they informed us they changed their policy the day before of only 21 and older can stay there. It was terrible service and they could care less if we had no where else to stay or not.

review.title: Nice hotel in older building
review.reviewText: Lobby, staff, and amenities were great. Walking distance to nice shopping and restaurants on Bay Street. Only downside was hotel room and entire hallway smelled like cigarettes, even though all rooms were non smoking.

review.title: Always good
review.reviewText: I've stayed here a few times evrn though I usually don't prefer Hilton but it's always a greet experience. Only bummer is paying $15 a night for parking. I feel like paying to park at the hotel you're staying at is ridiculous no matter where you are.

review.title: LOVE THIS HOTEL!
review.reviewText: Our 2nd time staying at this hotel and we will continue to stay here. Even if Expedia didn't send our reservations in I had to call then have them fax notification there was a wait for us to check in which was a little frustrating. The hotel took good care of us up graded our room to bay view and 2 complimentary drinks!! I think I'll use Hotel.com nxt time but overall LOVE this hotel!!!

review.title: Bed
review.reviewText:
Booked a king size bed and got there and was told they over sold.  Received 2 double beds!
What happened to when you reserve something you get what you pay for.. I paid $220 a night for a double bed.
Not a Happy Woman.
review.negativeRemarks: Give the consumer what they pay for.

review.title: Nice hotel but;
review.reviewText: After already dropping a large amount of money to stay her, they want to then charge $15 a day to park there.. Which is just absurd. I'm already paying to stay why should I have to pay to park as well. Would not stay here again just because of the parking.

review.title: Great location, great gym, breakfast buffet
review.reviewText: We were looking for a hotel either in SF or close by for the night.  This Hilton Garden Inn is a great location, right off the freeway coming into SF.  I was delighted by the gym as it has three treadmills and three elliptical machines and freeweights with lots of room.  They offer a breakfast buffet for 14.95 which is a bit pricey if you really don't want to eat all that much; however, the staff gave us a discount considering we didn't.  I will definitely stay at this hotel again when necessary!
Great hotel and close proximity to San Francisco.  I would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to UC Berkeley and shopping.
review.reviewText: This hotel was surprisingly very nice...I previously stayed at the Extended Stay America which seems low budget compared to this hotel. Both were about the same price. This hotel is much newer and cleaner. Check in was a breeze and "Jessica" was pleasant and informative. My only complaint is that our 12th floor room faced the freeway and was EXTREMELY NOISY at night. I saw signs regarding possible noise from the construction of the new Shell station adjacent to the property but since I was there during the weekend (Friday-Monday, a holiday) I did not hear any construction noise. The freeway noise was so bad, I slept with earplugs which were provided for the gas station construction. Also, parking was $15 per night which I thought was excessive and which was not mentioned in the pricing.

review.title: Very clean, welcoming hotel.
review.reviewText:
The staff are the nicest, most accommodating people I've encountered at a hotel in a long time.  They are professional, friendly and give a refreshing new spin on the word "service".  I chose this hotel by default -- all other affordable hotels in downtown San Francisco were booked due to conventions. I'm very glad I stayed there. The Hilton Hotel 
corporation should be very proud of this property.

review.title: nice staff, excellent stay.
review.reviewText:
pleasant stay. very friendly and accommodating staff. 

If you prefer the quieter room, ask the bay side instead of the freeway side.
review.negativeRemarks: parking $15/day is a rip off.

review.title: Nice hotel, view of bay bridge
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, convenient access to freeway, easy drive to the city. As a Hilton Honors member got free water and room with a phenomenal view of Bay bridge. Clean room.

review.title: Nice hotel for San Francisco visit
review.reviewText: Received a deal on this hotel through Expedia. Very nice hotel - would have been out of my price range without the deal. 3 police cars were in the parking lot when we arrived and were just leaving as we were checking in. Not sure what happened, but the hotel staff were professional and calm and I felt safe. Our stay was very nice and breakfast was excellent. Hotel staff was very friendly. Short drive into San Francisco, only con was the toll road. Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Okay hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel to watch the fireworks from San Francisco Bay I didn't know how far Emeryville was from San Francisco but we were able to see the fireworks and the hotel was cool I will go back again.

review.title: Nice hotel in Emeryville
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was excellent - friendly, courteous, attentive and helpful.  The room was comfortable, clean and in general quiet.  Coffee and tea were available in the main lobby 24/7.  We also used the hotel shuttle service which ran on time.  The driver was very friendly and patient.  The on-site parking fee is also very reasonable compared to hotels in SF: $15/day.  All in all, we had a wonderful stay at the Hilton Garden Inn.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby there are shopping areas and quite a few restaurants.  Berkeley, a vibrant college town, is about 10 minutes by car.

review.reviewText: Fantastic! Very friendly staff and great breakfast

Cons:
 double beds are full so it can get tight if it's more than 2 persons

I brought it up to the staff and they said they refreshed the room but I'm not sure they did because it continued to happen.
I also requested a clean set of towels and had to request it 3 times and a day after before they actually brought them to my room

Doesn't matter what side of the hotel you're on because both sides offer amazing views, not to mention the proximity to the Bay Bridge. We were about a 10 minute drive from Berkely and if you're not interested in driving anywhere there's a great park within walking distance offering gorgeous views of the whole bay.

We enjoyed our stay so much we added an extra night!

The sucky part is you have to pay for parking each night at the hotel ($15) and if you plan on going to S.F you have to pay bridge toll every time, but despite that it was an amazing, fun experience. We would most definitely do it again.

review.title: Convenient location with a car, helpful staff

Check in was a breeze, front desk staff are very helpful. Parking was easy, ask if the $15 daily charge can be waived. A bit tricky learning the way around Emeryville getting on/off freeways, but they are all right there. You can possibly walk to the shops nearby - Starbucks, Jamba Juice, Apple Store. Free shuttles to MacArthur BART. 

Room was okay - big, Keurig, bed was really comfy. Just a bit dated decor. Some traffic white noise being by the freeway but they give you earplugs. Nice tv, wifi was a breeze on multiple devices, no in-room safe.

review.title: Friendly Staff

review.title: Love it

Love it

review.title: Nice hotel close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayes for 3 days. The hotEl was a great location right off of the highway. The rooms, bar, and restaurant were all clean and very comfortable. I would stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel

review.title: Perfect location for East Bay and SF

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the stay amenities were quite nice, didn't need anything other than what was there.

review.title: Nice hotel quite area

review.title: Very comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: the hotel is relatively close to Berkeley an just across the Bay from San Francisco, so convenient to both those needs.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was reasonably quiet.

review.title: Nice hotel with great staff
review.reviewText: We had a great stay. The staff were polite and accommodated to our needs. There's was only one problem with our stay "the tv". When we first arrived the tv worked fine but later on it started cutting off and the remote control stopped working. We were moved to another room which was nice. It was 1 am, we were moved from the 11th floor to the 7th floor. That was a con considering our original placement.

review.title: Great room, great view, great staff!

review.title: Everything good but the restaurant.
review.reviewText:
We were told the restaurant would be open at four in the afternoon.  We waited an hour.  We got to the restaurant and nobody was there.  We asked the bartender and he was very rude.  After 10 minutes of waiting for. service we left
 I have to say that the front desk was very helpful and courteous.  Great hotel but do not plan to have dinner there.
This hotel was ok. Everything was good except the fact that We found hair all let the bathroom.

review.title: Double beds . . .  Really?
review.reviewText: Booked a room for 3 adults, and got 2 double beds.  It was like a time=warp back to the 60's.  When was the last time you slept with another individual in a double bed.  Not very comfortable.  The lobby was very nice, with friendly and helpful staff behind the counter.  The buffet breakfast was adequate, and excellent  service was provided.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was very good for our purposes.  It was within walking distance from shopping and good restaurants as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Twin, King, and Queen -sized beds should be the standard.  Lose the full-sized beds.

review.negativeRemarks: The beds could be a little more comfortable.

review.title: Dylan concert get-away
review.reviewText: The Hilton Garden Inn in Emeryville is perfectly located - close to everything we like to do in the East Bay.  The hotel staff was friendly and efficient.  Our room was spacious and perfectly appointed.  It was the perfect place for a mid-week get-away!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, parking, and freeway access.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: We had tickets to see Bob Dylan at the Paramount Theater in Oakland. We took surface streets and arrived there from the hotel in minutes.

review.title: The hotel staff was wonderful.
