review.title: Emeryville shuttle is great and close.
review.reviewText: Traveled there for a sporting event from out of town, great place to stay and close to transportation was nice because we didn't have a car.

review.title: Decent place on the bay
review.reviewText: I only stayed one night so had a fairly limited experience but it was overall pretty good. Staff were friendly enough. Room was, large clean and modern. Only issue I had was the memory foam bed. I am no fan of those things - it might mould to me but it is still hard. Next morning I asked how to walk to the Amtrak station and was offered the free shuttle service. Very happy with my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Size and modernity of room was excellent.

review.title: Why reserve when you give our room away?
review.reviewText:
We reserved a king and they gave us two doubles. Not a big deal to some, but this was our one year anniversary and completely unacceptable. They gave no reason except that they were sorry that expedia does not let us know that it is first come first serve.

Why make a reservation then?!?!?

review.title: Good alternative to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Room had no USB charging ports for my IPad/Phone.
The hotel is close to US 80, the traffic noise may be disturbing if one's a light sleeper, I myself slept very soundly.
Coffee machine in room did not work, informed the front desk when checking out.
Was told during check-in process that there would be a charged for parking but were not in the end.
Overall a pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Less costly than hotels in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide USB charging ports.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel, near the pier and interstates.
review.reviewText: Didn't like the parking, but liked everything else (especially free coffee all day)
review.positiveRemarks: Close to what we were doing.
review.negativeRemarks: parking
review.locationRemarks: Eat at the Townhouse Bar & Grill - reserves suggested - for lunch or dinner and The Black Bear Diner for breakfast.

review.title: Gotcha on the parking!
review.reviewText:
Two months ago, I stayed at the Four Points Hotel just on the other side of the freeway. Same price but far better experience! Really! When checking in the ran my credit card but charged me an additional $60 for incidentals but failed to explain that to me until I asked the front clerk at check out. She said they just put on hold on the card for the extra amount in case I do have incidentals! Nice! 
Here's the big gotcha! They charge guest $15 per night to park your vehicle. Add that to your rate they quote on Expedia! When checking into the room, we found it uncomfortably small! It would be okay for a single travel, but not 2 people. Very small and poorly designed. There is no closet, just an free standing armoire where you can hang a few items but not much. The bathroom vanity should be located outside the bathroom. Also no fan ventilation in the bathroom. It was broken... there just wasn't any!! Crazy. 
The good points to the property is that it is conveniently located to the freeway. BTW; they do offer ear plugs because the traffic from the freeway never stops. The rooms were clean and lobby pleasant. 

I wouldn't stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room design and layout is poorly planned.
review.locationRemarks: Close to lots of attractions.

review.title: Good Value, Good Service
review.reviewText: Location is tricky if you don't have a car.  Nice for running along the bay though, since it's on the water and there's a park at the end of the point.  It's a definite 3.5 star hotel, but clean, updated and the staff was friendly and accommodating.  No complaints other than the bed being a little hard and missing a layer between the sheepskin-like mattress pad and the bottom sheet.  Other than that, towels were new, bathroom updated (always a pet peeve when they're not) and the room was clean.  My room was directly across from the elevators and hardly heard any noise except the occasional 'ding'.  Hotel was nice enough to provide earplugs just in case!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Had a great time it's a pity about having to pay for the parking. A bit of traffic noise from the main road.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charges

review.reviewText: Great hotel,centrally located. Beds were especially comfortable!
Very clean and comfortable. Enjoyed our 1 night stay.

review.title: Had a bad experience from hotel staff
review.reviewText: The moment I checked in instead of being greeted with a smile the lady in the reception gave me a grumpy look asking how may she help me. I could notice the small gestures which goes long way in patronage. That was definitely missing. Not once,twice but at least 4 times during my stay for 2 nights I felt the hotel crew is prepared to cater the 'good looking' people while do not treat the others with same gesture. During check another couple was being offered two bottles of cold water for their 'long flight' while I was given a plain grumpy look during the same process. During checkout the guy in the counter said 'you are all set' while the lady who checked out just before me was greeted by 'Thanks for staying with us'. It was quite like yea .. U stayed .. Now get the hell outta here. Definitely never staying in this hotel again or recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Nice rooms ,clean ,location is excellent  we had a good stay

$15 per night for parking to stay in this hotel?!?!
is this how they make extra money??

review.title: Great location to stay for a Giants game!!
review.reviewText: Easy location to get to. Right off 1-80 just before the Bay Bridge. Close to good restaurants and nice staff!!

review.title: Hilton Garden Inn Review
review.reviewText: Good location if you have a car and want to travel to the city or hang out in the east bay.  There are plenty of restaurants and grocery stores nearby. The Trader Joes across the street was great since the hotel had a refrigerator and microwave.  The people at the front desk were really friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  Overall, it was a good experience.

review.title: Close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't too far from San Francisco, which was a huge plus. However; we did not appreciate having to pay so much for parking, especially when we stayed for several days. Regardless, the staff was nice and rooms were in good condition.

review.title: Close to San Francisco

review.negativeRemarks: Shouldn't have paring fees
review.locationRemarks: Close to Oakland airport, Berkeley, and San Francisco

review.title: Expensive hotel with Loud highway  view.

review.title: Great for near San Fran

Onsite restaurant was ok - decent food but a little pricey. If you are traveling to San Francisco, have a rental car, and don't want to pay $300  for a room downtown, this is the place for you.

review.title: Vacation to San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was located in a good area to be able to connect with transit systems in order to be able to get around. Rooms were spacious and lobby was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were exceptional. They assisted with all of our questions & gave us ideas on what to check out. Went above & beyond.
review.negativeRemarks: Unfortunately for us the mattress was way too firm for us. The cost of a soda was ridiculous.
review.locationRemarks: It was very easy to get to BART & travel into San Francisco without fighting the traffic. There were a million things to see and do close by.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great deal, great location, and amazing room. First time using Expedia and I will continue to use it, especially with Hilton Garden Inn. Room were quiet, comfortable, and clean. My girlfriend loved the mattress and pillows.
review.positiveRemarks: It was easy to get into SF, Oakland, and Berkeley. Everything was great. Really clean and comfortable.

review.locationRemarks: We bough the Go San Francisco Card and really maximized the card (pier 39, on&off tour, aquarium, California Academy & Science, coupons, and much more

review.title: Good value for money

review.positiveRemarks: Very well kept, everything like new.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds are not super comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location, very safe, nice little restaurants nearby.

review.title: Ideal Central Point for East Bay
review.reviewText: The hotel was situated in an ideal central location for going to the Berkeley or Oakland or hopping into San Francisco. I have lived in the east bay a decade ago and was back for only a few days and the hotel was clean, comfortable and the staff friendly and obliging with service and information. The rooms were quiet but alas we didn't get one with a view and there was no convenient way to see if there were rooms with a view on the website or from the reception people. The lobby was very noisy though and the elevators really slow. Only these two items keeps this place from getting top scores.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators and noise in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: There is always the wonderful 4th offerings across the freeway.

review.title: Great Value!
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel! Staff were courteous and are willing to go out of their way to make sure your stay is as comfortable and pleasant as possible. Room was clean and had a nice view of the Bay Bridge.  The hotel was conveniently located to shopping and restaurants in the area. If you're looking for a hotel in the area, stop looking and just go ahead and reserve.

It is a good Hilton type hotel with easy access to the bay bridge and Oakland.
THERE IS A $15 A DAY CHARGE FOR PARKING.
Great location,  Loved the bay view room! Reasonable rates!

Soso stay. Had to wait 45 minutes for check in because the room was not ready, and it was after 3 pm already. They gave us a free breakfast voucher though, which is nice. I would recommend this hotel only if you have a car. Otherwise it is quite a pain to get to the BART and back to the hotel, especially in the evenings. It was quite loud, too. There is construction work going on in front of the hotel, they are building a gas station. The overall location is not pleasing at all. The staff was friendly.

review.title: Ongoing construction
review.reviewText: Great location & accommodations but ongoing construction not pleasant to see out your window
Staff were great but hotel is under construction.

review.title: San Francisco Bay location
review.reviewText: Excellent place to stay. Beautiful bay view.  Loved the large bathroom and keurig coffee maker in room.  Only negative is daily parking fee added on to expenses.

review.title: Great hotel close to Oakland, Berkeley and SF
review.reviewText: Got there late so I cannot comment on the fully stocked bar and restaurant, but the front desk greeted us with a smile. Wasn't too happy to pay $15 for parking. I know a lot in Berkeley that charges $10 a weekend! But the room was clean and offered great view. Bed was comfortable

review.title: Dirty. Stay away.
review.reviewText:
The lobby looks nice, but that's the highlight from inside.

Runners and walkers would like the shore path by the bay for running and walking.

However a nice lobby is not worth the horrendous condition of the rooms, the dirty carpets and paper-thin walls that let you hear _everything_ that goes on in the room next-door. I noticed that hotel staff placed ear-plugs on the nightstand when I arrived and wondered why; it didn't take long. A fussy baby next door made it almost impossible to be in the room at all without the ear plugs in. Even the couple's conversation next door was as if they were in my room.

The carpets, sheets and the bathroom looked to be still dirty from the previous occupants. Stained carpet and frayed linens made me keep my shoes and clothes on until it was time to sleep. At 8pm a maid knocked on my door saying she was supposed to clean my room, which apparently meant it hadn't been cleaned before my arrival?

I hadn't eaten so tried to call room service 5 separate times but there was no answer. Finally I reached the front desk and they took my order. The food (half chicken/rice)came 45min later, was cold, bone dry and inedible. The salad I had ordered was swimming in oil dressing. The service person who delivered the food said he was the ONLY one taking and delivering orders, which explains the cold food and failure to answer the phone.

If there is another hotel option in this area, I would avoid this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: There is not enough space here to begin to address the problems I encountered.
review.locationRemarks: By the Bay bridge, Berkely. I've stayed at many Hilton Garden Inn's and all have been ok, but this location cannot be recommended.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay at the Hilton in Emeryville. It was close to everything and yet we were set apart and close to the bay. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the friendly staff and the continental breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Fans in the bathroom and free parking would be nice.

review.title: GREAT PLACE, GREAT VIEW!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is outstanding and the staff goes the extra mile to insure your comfort! The hotel sits near the water with a wonderful view of the Oakland/San Francisco Bay Bridge.

At night you have a beautiful views of San Francisco, Oakland/Berkeley hills lit up for wonderful scenery.

Besides great food your stay includes free WiFi. Come relax and enjoy your stay. You are just minutes from everything, traffic permitting!

review.title: Everything was great!
review.reviewText:
Everything was really great.
The breakfast was excellent!
I definitely recommend om that hotel!

review.title: Good place to stay!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Room was very nice but the bed and pillow were not comfortable they should have been replaced a few years ago.
review.negativeRemarks: Bedding was old

review.title: Nice, central hotel for bay area travel
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location if you want to explore the bay area (car recommended), though there is still lots to do in the area itself. Bay Street Shopping Center offers some good shopping and dinning options including a large AMC theater. There are a couple other shopping centers as well as a Regal in the area in case Bay Street doesn't offer what you are looking for. During my stay rates were better than the other major hotels, while still being reasonable. I felt that the hotel offered great value for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, comfortable rooms. Pricey but delicious buffet breakfast, though the selection was a bit limited for me to really consider it a buffet.
review.negativeRemarks: Public transportation at and around the hotel is lacking. Very difficult to travel without a car unless you are very familiar with area and bus system
review.locationRemarks: Right off the freeway for easy (minus traffic during rush hour) travel over to SF. Close by (long walk/short drive) is shopping/theater/dining.

review.title: nice hotel, view of the freeway, not the bay,
review.reviewText: several sirens/e-vehicles passed in the night. Noisy party happened next door for long time, not staff intervention.
review.negativeRemarks: charges for parking is a big personal complaint, just should not be necessary.

review.title: Nice Hotel needs sound proofing
review.reviewText: Everything was amazing about this hotel ....BUT and that's a HUGE but...the walls were thin. At 4 am with my two daughters laying in the next bed, I felt like I was listening to a live recording of a porno. They began yelling at 5am, at 7am the we're arguing about clothes. I didn't sleep and tried to keep the A/C on so my girls wouldn't hear a thing.

review.title: Nice hotel near the water and Berkeley
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at your hotel twice and hope to stay there again soon since our son just enrolled at Berkeley. The first time we faced the water and our stay was great. Last time we faced the mountains and could not sleep due to the traffic noise from the freeway. We requested that we be moved to the water side for the remainder of our stay and the staff accommodated us. The rest of our stay was great.

In the future, we will not stay at your hotel unless we are guaranteed a room facing the water.

Thank you.

D. Scott Becker
review.positiveRemarks: Location near the water and Berkeley
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing of rooms facing the freeway

review.reviewText: Very obvious the hotel is beautiful. Staff is super nice and helpful and I cannot complain about that bay view :) definitely staying here again soon.

review.title: Great alternative to San Francisco hotels!
review.reviewText:
The Hilton Garden Inn (Emeryville) is located just across from San Francisco at the foot of the Oakland Bay Bridge, and is minutes from the attractions. The rooms are spacious, and the common areas, corridors and guest rooms appear to have been freshly renovated as of my visit in May 2014 - - everything was beautiful and tasteful.

Overall, this Hilton property was a much better value than any of the hotels I'd visited in San Francisco, and I highly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious rooms, beautiful decor, friendly staff, plentiful parking with unlimited in-and-out privileges, and great value for the money!
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is only 100 yards from the freeway, so if you are sensitive to traffic noise, please request a room that faces west (towards San Francisco).
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located just across from San Francisco at the foot of the Oakland Bay Bridge, and is minutes from the attractions.

review.title: Wonderful hotel staff
review.reviewText: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff went out of their way to make things right. They gave me my room service meal for free because I had to wait to place my order.
review.negativeRemarks: Expedia had not given my reservation information to the hotel.

review.title: hotel
review.reviewText: other than not having towels replaced, the experience was good
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure to replace bath mats and towels
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to Oakland and San Francisco

review.reviewText: 2nd floor room. Checked in at 6 pm and the room looked out onto the roof and the air conditioning equipt. I can't remember a worse view and the room was over 100 degrees no A/C on . I was also informed that breakfast was addition cost and not included as previously informed. linens where super thin (sheets) and sub par. Otherwise a nice place to stay. Pleasent and helpful staff.

review.title: Great Hotel

review.title: Nice hotel

review.title: Nice Hotel

review.negativeRemarks: The parking

review.title: Centrally Located Between SF & East Bay
review.reviewText: Hotel is remodeled since last stay & is well done. We stayed 5 nites and had very easy access to both SF and East Bay plus there is good food/clothes/coffee shopping within a mile of hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience and location. The rates were very reasonable per night.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish parking wasn't $15.00/day. Seems a little steep.
review.locationRemarks: Oakland is a great foodie mecca now and San Francisco is easy access from this hotel.

review.title: super friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText: Any questions we had, no matter how silly we felt asking... they were very helpful and super friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very easy access to and from with adequate parking.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish they had an indoor swimming pool.
review.locationRemarks: I recommend Café Gratitude in Berkeley, CA for a wonderful dining experience!! I DO NOT recommend Emeryville Sportfishing for an activity.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location between SF and Oakland
review.reviewText: Our family spent one night here over the weekend for a "stay-cation." Great spot between San Francisco and Oakland. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and offered me room options when I checked in. I chose the room away from the elevator but no room view of the bay. The room itself was clean and comfortable. The bathroom had the best shower head I've ever experienced at a hotel along with Neutrogena products that were excellent. The next day, we had breakfast at the grill downstairs - the buffet breakfast was surprisingly good compared to other hotels'. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, even though it was only one night.
review.negativeRemarks: maybe the rooms could be a bit more spacious, but too late for that.
review.locationRemarks: Emeryville's a great location between San Francisco and Oakland.

review.title: Nice hotel but out of SF and noisy freeway nearby
review.reviewText: The staff and rooms were first class. Breakfast also good but fifteen dollars. We got free parking which was great. The only downside is that some rooms face on to the freeway and the traffic noise is horrendous - the hotel compensates by putting earplugs in rooms for use by guests. Much needed !! But overall a good hotel and can't fault it

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel because I was doing a class in the area.  I was on the 11th floor, on the highway side, far from the elevators.  I definitely heard traffic noise, but nothing that the provided pair of earplugs couldn't block out.  The room was very clean.  No complaints there.  I don't think I would travel just to stay here, but if I had another weekend course in the area, I would stay here.

review.title: Nice hotel - good location
review.reviewText: We were visiting relatives who live in Oakland and work in Berkeley. Couldn't have asked for a better location!

review.title: Not bad for Emeryville
review.reviewText: If you need a hotel in the East Bay, this is a pretty good choice. I'd make sure that I pay for a bay view room so that I don't face the highway.

review.title: AT&T PARK, Easy to and Back
review.reviewText: checked in , nice gated parking, able to come and go for 15.00, left for giants game easy access to bay bridge. came back to hotel , relaxed in lounge where they have nice couches and chairs. the bar is nice with flat screen tv's. bar tender is cool.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and layout of floor plan
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Location is great to go to Giants game or to the city.

review.title: Great price and location!
review.reviewText: We stayed so that we could fish in SF bay. Hotel added to our enjoyment, for sure.
review.locationRemarks: Fishing, biking, shopping...

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean, only disappointment was that the elevator wasn't working when we got back to the hotel the last night of the stay.. So we had to take the stairs to the 7th floor

review.title: Elevator break down
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and check in was pretty easy. I booked on expedia requesting two double bed room because there are three of us but we were upgraded to a king size room without pull-out bed. I called the front desk, the person was not helpful at all and told me that expedia does thigs like this all the time to over sale rooms. He told me to connect them directly but there is nothing they can do at the hotel because room is sold out! I tried to contact expedia but no luck so I called the housekeeping to ask of they can bring me something for my son to sleep in. The housekeeping was very nice a brought is a brand new air mattress. The next day the elevator kept breaking down. I don't think I will return to this hotel again.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and clean, bed was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, easy parking access. Noise of freeway was very minimal; a pleasant plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Hallway acoustics; the noise level was a bit loud at 3am (rude guests gabbing/laughing/slamming doors at 2am each night).
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to nearby restaurants (Townhouse Bar & Grill, for instance; highly recommend this place, too) and shopping centers, and Bay Bridge.

review.title: convenient to San Francisco and Bekerley
review.reviewText: the hotel is in good location close to the Bay, but the room facing the highway is very noisy due to the heavy traffic. The Emery Go Around shuttle is free and very convenient to McArthur station, but the Bart station (McArthur station) surrounding is not safe, not recommend to go out at night.

review.title: They Made me Miss My Flight!
review.reviewText: No shuttle on the day I had to leave, so they told me there was a bus at nine. There wasn't. Paid for a taxi and was still late to the plane. Missed my flight.
review.negativeRemarks: Better advice on transit.
review.locationRemarks: Emeryville is a Bay Area suburb with standard restaurant and shopping nearby, as well as a free around-town shuttle.

review.title: Private 'until the door came open'....
review.reviewText: The hotel overall was fine. The parking fee seemed a bit much, I understand parking is more expensive in the city. It bothers me when housekeeping comes in when I'm still in the room. They need some way to identify when a guest has issues with hearing. A quick tap at the door and before I could get up the door opens. She did quickly leave.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Things were pretty quiet. Had very little interaction with staff, but initial contact was very pleasant. We really loved the fact that the free city shuttle stopped right in front of the hotel.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights while on our trip to San Francisco since the hotels in the city were way too pricey. My grand total here was $421, that included a very spacious room with a king size bed, a fridge, microwave, Keurig coffee maker and parking for 4 days ($15 per day), taxes and all other fees; it was worth it! The bed was super comfortable and CLEAN. The cleaning staff was very friendly and greeted us everytime they saw us walking by. Overall it was a great experience and we will definately be staying here again when we visit the bay area. The location was perfect with freeways and a huge shopping center just down the street.

review.title: Cool
review.reviewText: cool happy comfotable did not like to haveing to pay for parking i am patrnizing your business

review.title: There's no garden there!
review.reviewText:
The gentleman who checked us in failed to inform us about the amenities, failed to give us our water bottles (no big deal, really, but ...) and generally did not appear interested. We had to pay for parking which was not mentioned on Expedia, the room was noisy (it came with bedside earplugs, standard), and had no view other than the industrial HVAC systems on the lobby roof which was at our floor level. Finally, despite being called the Hilton Garden Inn, there was no garden that we saw, inside or out, other than the floral print on the hallway carpet.

There was nothing fatally wrong with the hotel but there was nothing sufficiently right to make us return.
review.negativeRemarks: Expedia should alert users to "required" fees, like parking, to more effectively compare hotel prices.
review.locationRemarks: It was a bit scary to walk from the hotel to nearby attractions, shopping, dining. Not the safest area, especially at night.

review.title: Great customer service
review.reviewText: Booked a room through expedia facing the bay bridge, but when I got there I was told that all the rooms facing the bay bridge where all booked and that when you book a room through expedia you're only guaranteed a room. I told the guy that didn't make sense, that the whole reason I booked this hotel was for the view and he said sorry but he couldn't do nothing. At the time another front desk clerk kinda took over and said she will accommodate me, she got me the room I had booked originally, upgraded me to a king, gave me the parking pass for free ($15) and gave me 2 free drinks for the bar. The only complaint I have is the since in drinks from the 2 bartenders, ordered a bloody Mary, the first bartender an older gentleman was on point, the second bartenders bloody Marys were undrinkable, other then that I have no complaints.

review.title: Good location quiet
review.reviewText: Stayed here on two separate occasions. Very comfortable and has a good vibe the minute you walk in

review.title: Clean hotel
review.reviewText: Didn't like that there was no free continental breakfast and parking was $15 a night for what we pay the night those two things should be included

review.title: The Perfect Fit
review.reviewText: I needed a place to stay in Emeryville for the weeked while I did business there. I knew I would spend minimal time there but when I did I wanted it to be nice enough to feel as if I were treating myself. The renovations had just been completed but upon arrival the very friendly Front Desk staff gave me a coupon for 2 free cocktails at the bar. From there on out I felt exactly how i wanted to feel there; as if i were treating myself. I was put on the side of the building with a view of the bay, everything was immaculately clean, the facilities were quite exceptional, fancy coffee maker in the room, the whole shot. Booking through Expedia got me a great rate as well. If they didn't charge guests to park in their parking lot, it would've been Aces all around.
review.negativeRemarks: Give free parking or be more explicit about the charges from the onset.
review.locationRemarks: Good Sushi nearby, but the bar in the Hotel is just fine.

review.title: Last Minute
review.reviewText: My train was 7 hours late to Emeryville, so I had to book a room. It was expensive but they got me a room and even gave me a free breakfast which was a full on buffet breakfast. The beds were very comfortable and if I ever needed to be in Emeryville again I would most likely stay here.
review.locationRemarks: Right acrossed the Bay Bridge from San Francisco and right near the train station.

review.title: The parking was horrible.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice,but there were two events when we were there and there was not enough Parking. It was really bad
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly staff. Always ready to help

review.title: Nice hotel next to the Bay
review.reviewText: It was very pleasant to be able to walk out of the hotel and be on the walking/jogging path to the marina.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel location was extremely convenient. Very close to Bart, the Bay Bridge and San Francisco and the route to wine country.
review.negativeRemarks: The HVAC system on the lower roof was extremely noisy. A note on the night stand attributed the noise to the "sounds of the Bay." Really??
Free parking would be great, the noise of the fan is loud at night
Room cleanliness is sub-par. There is black mildew around bath tubs, in first room and also reassigned room.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, easy access to freeway, Bay bridge and the city.

review.title: A hidden gem. One of the best stays all around.
review.reviewText: Our stay was pretty much one of the most perfect stays in the bay area. First, the hotel is beautifully renovated, bright colorful and warm. The View from our room of the city was spectacular, definitely a million dollar view with poster like scenery of the bay and the city. In terms of the room it self, it was great. Everything was new but my favorite part was the incredibly comfortable bed. You can tell they spent a lot on the bed. I slept great and woke up feeling like a new man. The best part of the entire stay was the staff. They were very attentive and you can tell they took a lot of pride in making your stay outstanding. Ray was super nice when we checked in. She even called in later to make sure everything was fine. We can't wait to go back and stay there again before the property gets super popular and their rates double.

review.title: Convenient bay location/Excellent basics

review.title: ear plugs ?
review.reviewText: When one of the first things you see upon entering the room are ear plugs on the end table , you go wha ? The note on the table refers to Bay Sounds. What they are coloring up is the sound of the adjacent freeway. Perhaps if one books a room facing the Bay , away from the freeway , plugs would not be needed. The room itself is fine , clean and pleasant. The last negative thing is that they charge you $15 to park.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was well maintained and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: drop the parking charge and be honest about the " Bay Sounds ". Yea , I know . It's a business.

review.title: Nice Hotel, but not very close to many restaurants
review.reviewText: This is a very clean and comfortable hotel. I wish that there were more local restaurants. The staff was really friendly and I thought that the parking fee was reasonable and I felt that my car was safe.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Very surprised at the price for this hotel, wonderful location very close to bay bridge. Beautiful view of SF. Tremendous value... would highly recommend to anyone trying to stay comfortably for a very reasonable price.

review.title: Great experience.
review.reviewText: I only stayed for a short time but I would definately come back. Very clean, staff friendly.

review.title: My nights stay
review.reviewText: Stayed the night before a day of fishing....only a mile or so from the boats...All was good except for the bartender. We stopped at the hotel bar and ordered a night cap of good scotch for my fishing buddy and myself and it came to $26.50 and I paid with a $20 & a $10.... $30 bucks when he brought back my change I stuck in in my pocket......My habit when I go to a bar at a hotel that I am staying at is not to leave my change on the bar and not tip after each drink but to tip accordantly when I leave the bar anyway we had hardly sipped our scotch and the bartender comes back not to ask if the drinks were ok or if we wanted another he came back ask why I pulled my change from the bar that it should have as his tip. I found this very rude. Normally I would have left the bartender $4 to $5 bucks A $10 spot if we had another. My buddy and I looked at each other downed our scotch and left and I gave a bit extra to the deck hand on the boat the next day who worked his but off.
review.negativeRemarks: New Bartender
review.locationRemarks: Fishing

review.title: Cheapest decent place i could find in Bay Area
review.reviewText: The hotel was good for the most part but i didn't like the fact that they charged me $15 a night for parking in their parking space, which is just ridiculous and unheard of!!!! I have never had to pay to park at the hundreds of places i have stayed in over many years, from motels and inns to four star hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a pool, room service, and improve the quality of the breakfast.

review.reviewText:

review.title: What an awful first night - wrong room given.
review.reviewText:
The so-called front office manager was okay. The front desk staffer was terrible. Called the morning of first day of our stay. We had been placed in a Queen size room, despite booking a King room. The staffer did not seem interested in assisting with the problem. The so-called manager attempted to make it seem that it was our problem as opposed to bad customer service. In the end, the compensation was on $30.

That crappy Queen room also smelled of smoke - big no-no. In addition, the mattress was broken. There should not be so much difference between the two rooms. We figured it out, after the change.

The other excuse - they claim to be a franchise and cannot be as accommodating as other HGIs. For a hotel that seems to take pride in customer service, they failed.
review.negativeRemarks: Better customer service. All the staffer had to say: "I'm sorry we made a mistake. I will try my best to assist you."
review.locationRemarks: Near the Bay Bridge and Berkeley.

review.title: good ocean view.

This is my 5th time staying at this hotel, and it is still as amazing as the first time I stayed there. I got to take full advantage of the room, the gym, the pool, and the service from breakfast. review.title: Deceit stops me from returning to this hotel
review.reviewText: We reserved our room months in advance. A king size bed was all we asked for. On our reservation it said in big red letters"King size bed with mountain view". When we arrived in town at the airport it made more sense to check in late rather than going straight to the hotel to check in. We called the hotel to assure that we would get our king size bed if we checked. The reply was "yes". If we had any idea we would not get a room with a king size bed for checking in late we would have gone straight to the hotel right then and checked in. When we actually did check in we specifically said we were checking to our room with a king size bed. We were handed a pair of keys and instructed how to get to our room. To our surprise when we opened the door to our room with a king size bed we found two twins. We returned to the front desk to describe our disbelief of what we just went through. Eventually after several discussions of how they did not deceive us on giving us a room that we did not reserve they handed us another room key. Once again leading us to believe we were getting a room with a king size bed. This room actually had a double bed. We were so tired and told we had to pay for the room whether or not we slept in we took it for the night. In the morning we called the front desk to make sure we could transfer to a room with a king size bed we were told there were none available. The room we were given not the room we reserved was our room for the remainder of our stay. We left
review.negativeRemarks: Be honest!

review.title: Nice and clean.

review.title: Very enjoyable stay.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: We had a great few days staying at the Hilton Garden Inn. It was clean and comfortable. The hotel staff we very friendly and helpful. We would happily stay there again. The only mildly annoying thing was a very noisy fridge (hence the 4 above). We solved this by wedging towels around it to stop it vibrating and keeping us awake.

review.title: Sleep, don't eat.
review.reviewText: First room smelled of disinfectant but staff promptly gave me another at my request. Breakfast buffet is overpriced and bland--many good places to eat in Oakland so skip it. Parking is expensive. Beds are terrific and room was quiet.

review.reviewText: I've stayed here 3 times recently, for a total of about 10 days. I'll return any time I'm in the Bay area. The manager & staff go out of their way to be friendly & helpful. Each room has a refrigerator, microwave, & coffee maker. Some rooms have views of the Bay. The hotel is a block away from a walking/ biking path along the Bay, on which one can reach Berkeley in a bit more than a mile.

review.title: A pleasant stay but some hassels.
review.reviewText: I stayed serveral times at ths hotel during the past 4 to 5 years and the experience has been very positive, considering the relatively reasonable price. My only negative feedback this time was that I reserved a king-bed room and was given a double, was told that this was the only room available. When I checked in the room and called reception requesting a change, she insisted that the assigned room was a king! Later we did get a king room a floor up but was being held up for close to an hr.

excelent hotel

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
We loved this hotel. It has a great location, even if you aren't going to rent a car. They offer a shuttle service to the Mart station where you can get a train to the airport or to the local sights.

The beds are very comfortable with lots of soft pillows and duvet. Large bathroom too. I didn't like the closet set-up though. One hanger in front of another makes it difficult to see your outfits, but a very slight flaw.

The hotel is close to restaurants and entertainment. There is a great walking path that you can walk to. It goes along the bay and includes a marina park.

The staff were very helpful and they always had plenty of clerks working the front desk.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite thing about this hotel was the comfortable bed and pillows.
review.negativeRemarks: The closet was my least favorite thing about this hotel.

review.title: Great for all
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located in a great location, right in front of the bay. Although our room did not have a frontal view, it was still pleasing. All amenities and condition of the hotel was great.

However, I did prefer for the housekeeping to take more precise care in cleaning. I do mind cleanliness a lot, and seeing a few pieces of someone's hair (very minor) is not as pleasant.

review.title: great hotel for anyone

review.title: Great!! :)

review.title: Great hotel for families and business travelers al
review.reviewText: Extremely comfortable bed, excellent shower, good location, pleasant staff. The only negative is that you have to pay $10 for parking. We stayed two nights at separate times. Overall--a very pleasant experience.

review.title: Not great

review.title: Joyless, Lack of amenities.
review.reviewText: We chose the hotel because of the outside whirlpool, but it was broken and HAD been closed for a while. We were not notified and brought our bathing suits for nothing. There is no complimentary breakfast, just a $15.00 breakfast, which was really disappointing because every hotel we have ever stayed at has one. Once you check in you are informed of a $10 per day fee for parking. And even though we were comped with free parking after I complained about lack of whirlpool, etc, the fact remained that the hotel was lacking amenities and the staff was joyless and robotic. Never again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice water pressure in the shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Being misled.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything, but not a beautiful location, all concrete and business. Highway very loud.

review.title: Generally a thumbs up.
review.reviewText:
First of all, the hotel met my list of general requirments;
- Clean room.
- Comfortable bed and pillows.
- Plenty of hot water, water pressure and good height on the shower head.
- Reasonably quite.
More...
Front desk folks were very nice. Parking was OK, but $10 per day. I skipped the $15 breakfast buffet. It didn't look any better than the breakfast I got for free last week with an $84 room. TV video was the best quality that I've seen at a hotel. Not the TV itself, but the actual service. Real HD....nice. Plenty of security folks, which I guess you need when you're this close to Oakland...sigh.
review.positiveRemarks: I love that there is a nice long running trail along the bay that starts just a block from the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The expensive breakfast buffet.

The room was clean and did not have any of those yucky old bed covers, but had nice clean white duvet covers. A very comfortable hotel at a great price!

review.title: Nice location, great accommadations

Nice hotel, easy to get to from California Zephyr train station in Emeryville. Shuttle picked us up promptly and driver informed us of places to eat close by the hotel. Nice location with views.

Was great for family and/or friends.
