review.title: Good, clean hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient, comfortable, and clean. Other than some difficulty with the GPS over which entrance was currently open, we checked in and had a very nice stay.

review.title: Avoid the second floor
review.reviewText:
Do not let the hotel put you on the second floor facing the bay. You will look out on multiple steel contraptions at the same level as the window, with fans and motors, and the constant sound from them is unendurable. I asked to be moved to another floor; they said they were booked, had no other rooms but could give me earplugs. Finally they said they could give me a room with a pull-out sofa bed only, several floors up. I took it, since I could not stay in the 2nd floor room. Fortunately, I do not need an actual bed as much as I need freedom from constant high pitched motor sounds.

Other travelers I think mentioned parking spaces being too small, but I found plenty of standard sized spaces and it wasn't a problem at all.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast buffet was a real plus.
review.locationRemarks: Easy freeway access.

review.title: Nice Stay, Good Price & Location
review.reviewText: Called and requested early check-in, no problem. Room very clean & comfortable. Hotel has nice good sized air conditioned work out facility with newer machines. Had breakfast in the restaurant and service was good.
review.locationRemarks: Good location right of Hwy 880 before the Bay Bridge-Oakland/Alameda split, easy-on-off. Traffic can be a bit congested depending on time of day.

review.title: They need to pay more attention to the hotel needs
review.reviewText: Front service very good , house keeping staff needs to pay attention to details , our bed mattress was sinking from one side , we were in room 702 on the 7 floor lots of traffic noise from the freeway ; forniture is kind of old , Good tv , but not very many channels ; parking is 10.00 every day , refrigerator has no freezer , coffe , but only 2 little bags of suger per day jejejje what about your wifes coffe ? jjejejejejeje , over all is good for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: location , privacy , nice entrance , very helpful front staff.
review.negativeRemarks: the bed , heater did not work at all , 10 dollars parking per day , house keepers did the minimum on bath rooms.
review.locationRemarks: location is great .

review.title: OVER BOOKED
review.reviewText:
WE REQUESTED TWO DOUBLE FOR THREE ADULTS. WHEN WE GO THERE, THEY SAID THEY WERE OVER BOOKED. GIVEN A KING BED AND A COUCH (PULL OUT) WHICH RATHER UNCOMFORTABLE FOR MY 6 FOOT 3 INCH 30 YEAR OLD SON.

OTHER WISE, LIFE WAS VERY GOOD.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Food and shopping close. Friendly staff.

review.title: Very nice experience
review.reviewText: Very good Hotel but no as excellent as Hilton should be. Nice clean roon with nice views and everything you need. Friendly personnel at check in and check out. Paid parking lot should be free for the guests considering you have to pay for crossing the bay bridge every time to go to San Francisco. In general it was a very nice experience to stay at this Hotel.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel over the Easter weekend and upon arriving was very pleasantly surprised with the both the property and the operation. The desk staff were efficient, polite and helpful. The room was clean and well-maintained. I had read previous reviews about the freeway noise, so I asked for a room away from the highway. The trade-off was that I got a queen bed instead of a king, but along with it, a nice view of the bay. This is a very good property for the money. Just a word of caution, the bar was nice, bar staff friendly, but the drinks were pricey. I will stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Exceptional customer service, clean/well appointed rooms, very nice fitness center
review.negativeRemarks: bar prices were a bit high
review.locationRemarks: Property is located along the East S.F. Bay in Emeryville. Convenient to both the Richmond and Oakland Bay Bridges.

review.title: parking/breakfast not included
review.reviewText: when you arrive to the hotel, you find out that parking and breakfast is not included. otherwise, hotel itself as expected, location is great
review.negativeRemarks: parking/breakfast cost extra

review.title: Friendly staff and nice rooms.
review.reviewText:
The staff was amazing. They were so friendly and helpful. They had cookies out on the counter for us and a coffee bar always set up.
The rooms were nice.The bed was super comfortable. We had a large room with a king bed. Could be a little updated but overall it was clean and tidy. I really liked that they had a little kitchenette- microwave, coffee pot and fridge in your room. That was a nice touch.
They have a cafe that has a breakfast buffet that was really convenient and a little store for snacks.
The walk to restaurants and stores is a little far but manageable.
All in all it was a nice hotel. I would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to updated a little.
review.locationRemarks: In a business park on the other side of the freeway from stores and restaurants.

review.title: good location, will charge fee for parking
review.reviewText: The location is great, the price is good, easy access to freeway, but the room facing the street can be noisy. It seems unseasonable the hotel will charge fee for the parking.
review.negativeRemarks: parking fee
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Not so great
review.reviewText: Very blah , and the bed was horrible, my lower back went out.

review.title: Solid Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and very comfortable. I had a good stay. Internet was fast and check-in and out was fat as well. I had no problems during this stay and would return here if I get back to the area.

review.title: Great Bay view from hotel!
review.reviewText: Me and my daughter arrived early to the hotel and was greeted and were able to check in early due to a room became available ~ word of advise if you are coming out to this hotel Shuttle will take you out 3 miles out and will pick you up which is fine but a rental car or taxi is needed to get to the galleries or museum. Which we took the Bart train from the SFO airport which was a long ride and cost $10 per person for a Friday took the Emeryaround shuttle to the hotel which I took the wrong shuttle but made it to the Hotel ~ also was disappointed that the Grill place to eat @ the hotel was closed when we checked out on Saturday but was only open for breakfast that was the only downfall of the hotel ~ the beds were so comfortable with the softes pillows and bedding ~ there are restruants, shops, but again a word of advise if venturing out and taking a cab return early due to some cabs dont go to certain areas for pick up =( we had to wait 2 hours but thank goodness for the hotel host to call the cab service to make sure we got picked up
review.positiveRemarks: Very Helpful Staff at front desk & Johnathan @ the Grill was very helpful with places of interest & even provided us with a map
review.negativeRemarks: Wanted to eat before heading out of hotel to plan the day & realize the grill was closed but was only open for breakfast ~
review.locationRemarks: Location is great if you are looking to get away from the city and have the view of the bridges and bay - but a car is really needed

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Stay here whenever I'm in the area. I dont recall being charged for parking in the past, but it's not a huge issue.

review.title: Noisy Hotel Overlooking Highway.
review.reviewText: Had room 1224, overlooking the highway. Very noisy room. Heard traffic, motorcycles, sirens all night long. Otherwise, a nice hotel with a nice bar and grill. Convenient access to Bay parks near Emeryville and Berkeley.

review.title: BEST sleep on a hotel mattress!!!
review.reviewText: This is probably the best hotel I've stayed at. . . I normally just go the "cheap" route when I book a hotel. I figure, it's just a place to sleep. But my boyfriend & I spent 1 night at the Hilton and it was the best hotel we've stayed at!!! We're still talking about it. Very modern and updated decor, very clean, and BEST bed ever!!!! The best sleep I've ever had on a hotel mattress!!!!! Stayed there on a Saturday night after a concert, and it was quiet and low key hotel. Next time I have to book a hotel, I will be staying at the Hilton.
review.negativeRemarks: The traffic around the busy shopping area down the street. . . but you can really avoid it if you try
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel is in a good area, right off the freeway. Kind of a lot of traffic around the on/off ramps of the freeway

review.title: n/a
review.reviewText: was ok had a few issues with the entry key had to be re-keyed twice
review.positiveRemarks: great view of the bay convienance to resturants and entertainment
review.negativeRemarks: paying for parking not a big fan

review.title: Good Bargain at Convenient Location
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this property many times over the years, although this is the first time since it became a Hilton Garden Inn. The property was nicely renovated and facilities upgraded. It is in a convenient location for the entire bay area. The open and relatively unsecured parking lot should still be free, but the $10 charge is not too harsh. Overall the property provides a decent value in the area.

review.title: I Will Stay There Again
review.reviewText: The hotel is bright, pleasant, and clean. The staff friendly is and efficient. And the price very reasonable.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient access to San Francisco and to East Bay locations.

review.title: I would go back again.
review.reviewText: Friendly, clean and food great. Hotel staff just wonderful.
review.locationRemarks: Fifteen minutes to downtown San Francisco.

review.title: NIce place to rest
review.reviewText: I was looking for a quiet, clean, comfortable place to rest before my concert and spend the night. The hotel provided just such a space.

review.title: Hilton Garden Inn a Winner
review.reviewText:
My wife and I were very pleased with our stay at Hilton Garden Inn San Francisco/
Oakland Bay Bridge.

The personnel could not have been nicer and our room was clean and spacious.

We will be back!

review.title: It is neat and clean. Not bad for a few days stay.
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel is clean and neat. Front desk staffs are friendly. It is a good choice for short term stay. But there is a $10 parking fees per night which I do not think it should be in that neighborhood. Do not forget to add the parking fees when you compare price.

review.title: Nice place to stay while visiting
review.reviewText: staff was very courteous and attentive. Only slept at hotel while visiting family, friends. Close to Berkeley, SF, and Oakland. Would stay there again. You do get dinged for parking $10/day.
review.locationRemarks: Berkeley for its diversity and community.

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: Excellent room, bed was sooo comfortable! Staff very courteous and helpful.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: We were treated very well at the desk, given a room facing the Bay (away from the freeway) quite cheerfully. We did not eat at the hotel, but there are many great places across the freeway in Emeryville. Room was clean and comfortable; only problem was spotty wifi, but there was also a hardwire connection which worked great. We'd certainly stay there again. Staff was great, and cookies at the front desk were a treat!

review.title: Very comfotable; great service and food
review.reviewText: I found the service really excellent and slept like a baby on their super comfortable bed. Ordered food service that definitely above average. I will stay there again.

review.title: Great place-worth every dime.
review.reviewText: I will probably go back there when I am in the bay area. The room was beatutiful, along with the ocean view, very clean place, nice and friendly staff with a killer breakfast. 4 thumbs up lol
review.locationRemarks: Emeryville, or Berkely, great location by the water

review.title: "What were they thinking"
review.reviewText:
First, let me say, I knew the hotel was going to be by the Interstate. However, I expected the rooms to be more soundproof than they were. It's a Hilton, so I thought it was a couple of steps up from a Holiday Inn or Radisson. What I did not understand was, why did they build the hotel with one side facing I-80 & the other facing the water. (North/South exposure) They could have built the hotel with an East/West exposure and both sides would still have a view of the water, but limited noise from the thousands of cars that are a stone's throw from the hotel. Or used double pane windows to cut down on the expected noise.
The food at the Hilton was just ok. The food at the nearby Chevy's was just ok. A small bottle of Nestle's water was over $2. Parking was $10.50 per night. The room was clean, but when I picked up one of the hand towels, it looked liked someone had just shined a pair of brown shoes with it.

The staff was friendly.

Best thing and worst thing was convenience to I-95. I was able to quickly leave and get to the airport in San Francisco.

Next time I would stay closer to the Emeryville shopping area where the Marriott is located. More money, but no 18 wheelers going down the road 24/7.
review.locationRemarks: Bay Street--Nice shopping

review.title: Room was too small
review.reviewText: The place was great and easy to access. The issue was that the room was so small, you could barely move around. I have stayed at other hotels in Emeryville, including once where I had a two-room (separate bedroom) hotel room for about the same price. Someone can be sleeping/showering in that other room, and the others can hang out in the living room/kitchen. This is strictly a personal preference.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel when we went to San Francisco for the Breast Cancer 3Day walk. Location was perfect. Hotel was clean and quite. Staff was friendly and informative. Hotel was centrally located to the 3Day events, which is the reason I selected it. We went out to dinner Sunday night and there were some nice restaurants within a short drive, also a movie theater. The hotel has a free shuttle to the BART station and from there I paid $8 to get to the SFO airport. You just need to schedule the shuttle to pick you up a couple hours before you need to leave.

review.title: one of the best values ever for the quality
review.reviewText: Highly recommend this property, Great service, cleaniness, and best of all, great location ( close to Bay Bridge). Price was the icing on cake

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: We could not get into our room early, so we had to wait 45 mins. Then when we did get up to our room. It was the wrong room. Had to go back down and get another room........ too much work for a room. Not Impressed....

review.title: Great stay better then the woodfin
review.reviewText:
Great Breakfast
Nice modern room and flatscreen
Loads of towells and complimentary products
Polite helpful staff

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: We loved our time spent at the Hilton. Free shuttle to the bart station, close to shopping and very friendly and courteous staff. We'll stay here again. The hotel met all of our needs.

review.title: fine place to stay
review.reviewText: The Hilton Garden Inn is a fine place to stay. Elevators are painfully slow, but otherwise the place & service are grand.

review.title: Nice hotel at a nice location
review.reviewText:
The Hilton Garden Inn is located in a quiet corner of Emeryville by the San Francisco Bay, east of San Francisco. Good overall cleanliness and friendly staff.

What I liked the most was the location of the hotel. It is by the Emery Go Round bus stop (shuttles people to MacArthur BART Station) and close to the Emeryvile Amtrak Station.

review.title: Great Hotel just accross the Bay bridge from San Fran
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay and the made to order breakfasts were fantastic

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay. Convenient to all areas.

review.title: Too Noisy
review.reviewText: Hotel was very noisy due to 50% of the rooms facing 880 with all day and all night traffic. Too risky to try booking hotel again as there is a 50-50 chance of facing the freeway again.

review.title: East Bay Trip
review.reviewText: Staff was courteous and patient. I walked into the bar with only 5 minutes before the kitchen closed. They still took my order with a smile. Thats service.

review.title: solid, not awesome
review.reviewText:
The people were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well furnished.
Nothing you would not expect at a hotel in this price range, but nothing to say "this is my new home away from home."

I found the food in the buffet to be lacking. At $13.95 I would expect a more satisfying breakfast.

The hotel is also freeway close with quick access to the city should one desire to cross the bridge.

review.title: Great Hotel Near San Fran and Oakland
review.reviewText: Great hotel

review.title: traveler from Canada
review.reviewText: Good value. Good friendly services. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Will stay there again on next visit. Recommend if you don't need to stay in SF.

review.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY
review.reviewText: Great location. Easy access on and off the freeways. GREAT hotel staff. They greatly exceeded our expectations. Rooms were great. Restaurant was great. We will be back!

review.title: Mos Def go back!
review.reviewText:
I really like staying this side of the Bay Bridge! In some ways it's more convenient than being in the City and you can just see the beautiful San Francisco skyline across the bay anyway!
great view!
Emeryville has easier parking, it's closer to home, easy getting gas, has shopping, movies, Peet's coffee, etc.
n i i i c e !

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Great place to stay if you do not want to pay the high rates of San Francisco. Wonderful hotel, great staff, and a nice breakfast offering that will please anyone no matter the type of traveler. Parking is only $5 compared to $30 to $50 in the city and a short BART ride that costs around $6k round trip. If you are looking for a wonderful, clean place to stay while still being able to see the city, this is the place.

review.title: Excellent choice for Berkeley or Downtown San Fran without Downtown prices.
review.reviewText: We got a last minute deal on our trip to Berkeley and got this 3 star hotel for 50% off. We chose an area and the Hilton Garden Inn accepted the deal. This is the second time I've stayed in a Hilton Garden Inn, through a Name Your Own Deal. The other time was in Sacramento. Both times the hotel has been lovely, with excellent service and accoutrement s. It is located right off the freeway in Emeryville, just one exit south of Berkeley and a half mile from the Bay Bridge. Downtown SF was 30 minutes away in rush hour. Berkeley was 3 - 7 minutes depending on the exit you wanted. I highly recommend it, especially if you aren't paying full price!

review.title: Emeryville
review.reviewText: n/a

review.title: We'll be back!
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely nice and looked newly renovated. Our room was very comfortable and well appointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in or near Emeryville. We will stay here the next time we come to the area.

review.title: convenient and good price
review.reviewText: great breakfast

review.title: My favorite bay area hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service from the start to finish. Room was clean & comfortable. Breakfast buffet was more than expected. We were just apprehensive that new management is taking over, per notice in front.

review.title: Excellent stay by the Bay
review.reviewText: Excellent stay by the Bay

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText:
The staff was very friendly and helpful. the continenal breakfast was very nice.
We enjoyed our stay and will probably return there if we have the occasion to be in the area over night.

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText: Hotel was useful for our purpose which was an overnight stay to catch an early morning Amtrak train. The hotel was clean and comfortable and would stay again if itineary required. While booking with expedia i asked for a hotel close to Amtrak station so we were pleased that we didnt have far to travel.. Would have liked if the complimentary shuttle service was operational but it wasnt so it was another taxi fare

review.title: reasonable accomodation
review.reviewText: very serviceable hotel. Not fancy but they don't try to be.

review.title: Work perfect for our graduation visit.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our one night stay. The staff was exceptionally pleasant. The location is easy to find and was also a good match for attending a Berkeley graduation.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: It was agreat hotel for the appointments we had, the local restaurant was great, it was recomended by the hotel staff.

review.title: THEY CHARGE FOR PARKING
review.reviewText: THEY CHARGE FOR PARKING WHICH PEOPLE SHOULD BE AWARE OF BEFORE BOOKING

review.title: Friendly staff; unfriendly parking lot.
review.reviewText: Overall, we were very pleased with our accommodations and the hotel staff. The downside was the parking lot which requires a card key to get IN and OUT and sometimes the machines can't read the keys.

review.title: Nice stay, but $5 parking?!
review.reviewText: I would stay there again. Nice, comfortable and clean room.

review.title: I will be back again
review.reviewText: I love the location of the hotel with the view of the bay. I was hoping for a room with the view of the bay but when we arrived there was a wedding party already there. I love the bay area/San Francisci so this is my choice of hotel whenever I stay in the bay area.

review.title: Emeryville Journey
review.reviewText: Everthing was great except that we couldn't get two queen beds. We had double beds. Great location

review.title: I liked it and would return again
review.reviewText:
I liked the hotel and the staff. Everyone was nice and the room was clean. Parking was $5 which is much less expensive than other places.
I travel to the Bay Area for work and I liked this hotel and I would (will) return again.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful and squeaky clean hotel, breakfast buffet was delicious as well as their restaurant.

review.title: Good hotel conveniently located.
review.reviewText: The room was clean and comfortable. The restaurant fare and service was satisfactory but somewhat on the pricey side for what you get.

review.title: nice play to stay
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very near to the bay bridge. The view was great from the window, loved it!

Room is decently clean, bathroom was clean too

Will stay again!

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText:
I often go to the Berkeley/Emeryville area and find this hotel both convenient and good quality. Internet connectivity is always important to me and they had good signal and easy connectivity.
To my pleasant surprise the food at the bar was good and I was able to get work done while have luscious nachos.
The only thing that I would try to improve is the amount of equipment in the fitness room. I'm an early morning treadmill addict and both treadmills were occupied at 5 AM (so next day I went at 4:30 AM). Plus they should revitalize one of the treadmills.

review.title: Nice hotel, very convenient location
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice, very conveniently located, easy freeway access, great american breakfast every morning, friendly staff. There were some things that i didn't like - wireless internet in my room wasn't working (it was connected, but I couldn't browse the internet at all!), floor in my room wasn't vacuumed (there was someone's fake nail right in the middle of the room!). Overall, it was very good for it's price. i would probably stay there again.

review.title: Can't wait to get back
review.reviewText:
We were traveling by train, which shall we say is not always on time. When I called and told the manager of the hotel that we would be late there was no problem. We checked in at 3 in the morning on the return part of our trip. No problems at all
We ate in the cafe the next morning and when I said we were pushed for time we were acomodated very nicely. I can't remember the names of the people who helped and I wish I could as I know how nice it is to get name recognition.
It was very nice to stay there for the short times we did. Both coming and going.
We walked to the hotel at 3 in the morning from the train station and reversed the process later in the morning. For us it is about a 10 minute walk and the area was okay.

review.title: Terrific service, Terrific Hotel
review.reviewText: I could not have been more pleased with my stay. The entire staff was extremely helpful and courteous. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. The location was great and the shuttle service was available on weekdays.

review.title: Adequate for business.
review.reviewText: I stayed here for an entire week by myself and was given two double beds. It would have been more convenient and comfortable with one bed, more room to move around in for the week. My view was of the top of the awning to the entrance of the hotel. Getting to my business destination was quite the task, manuevering through several lights although I only went less than a mile. The staff was very friendly however, although my one pet peeve happened again. On the third day, my key to the room didn't work and neither did my parking key, very inconvenient since I went all the way to my room to discover it didn't work at the end of a tiring day, then had to return to the lobby to get it fixed. I did enjoy the chocolate cookies in the evening, though.

review.title: Would Definitely Return........
review.reviewText: Found the Hotel and Staff to be extremely accomodating and conveniently and would definitely make plans to return!! Loved the added touch of the lemonade and cookies, what a refreshing and homey feel!

review.title: It was okay
review.reviewText:
Lots of little problems went wrong while i was there, the hotel staff were USUALLY extremely nice and accommodating. The power in my room went out. They couldnt find my belongings that I had left at the front desk for safe keeping, while they were looking noone told me what was going on. I was waiting for maybe 20 mins, and I had to ask if everything was okay.

Kitchen staff were mostly extremely nice, one lady was over the top mean... but I think she worked in the kitchen rather than out with the public.

room was nice. View was nice. Food was good. The waffles were amazing! Over all the experience was pretty good! No 5 star experience though.

review.title: Holiday Inn has morphed into Hilton Garden Inn
review.reviewText: This hotel is a big, old, renamed Holiday Inn in Emeryville, last exit before the Bay Bridge. The hotel's footprint is the same, the bar just off the lobby is the same, but the rooms have been nicely remodeled. The parking, however, is a nightmare! What used to a be a comfortable, large, free parking lot is riddled with complicated, unmaned gates and confusing in-and-out lanes. It has become a chore to come and go from this hotel. And there is a new parking fee to boot. Yes, it's only five dollars but yikes it's hard to manage. All in all though it's a good bargain with the inexpensive Expedia rate.

review.title: Comfortable rooms, easy access to SF, CA
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable but small. However, the guest services were very good. Great access to the freeway & SF, CA. I would stay there again.

review.title: Hilton Garden Inn San Francisco/Oakland Bay Bridge
review.reviewText: Hotel is great -

review.title: Pleasant Surprise
review.reviewText: This old renovated place seems a bit tired. However, the people were the friendliest and the Room service food was excellent. Gym was large and had new equipment. I usually stay across the street at the Marriott, but this price was unbeatable. I'll be back.

review.title: will think twice
review.reviewText: The hotel is located right off highway with easy access. However, during my stay we ran into two different group once in evening and once in morning in the lobby for meeting. The crowd were very noisy and stood in the way. If you are looking for quiet and safety for your hotel stay, please think twice.

review.title: $5 for parking, internet didn't work
review.reviewText: On 9/5/09 my wife and I stayed two nights at the Hilton Bay Bridge. I was upset to find that the hotel now charges for parking ($5 a night) when 4 other hotels in the area offer free parking? Not only did the parking upset me but when we got to our room the Internet would not work? I called the front desk and the agent said that they did not have anyone that could help me. The earliest they could get someone to the room would be Sunday afternoon. They repaired the Internet line but not until Sunday evening. After being a silver card holder for quite sometime I would think I would deserve better service? As for the parking, it kept the unwanted cars out but not the prostitutes! Saturday night there was one wandering outside the lobby entrance. I don't know if there was a change of franchise ownership or they just don't care? I suggest if they want to secure the parking then why not charge visitors instead of the paying hotel guests. I will be in Emeryville on September 12, 2009 and have made reservations at another hotel, 2 blocks away from the Hilton and No charge for parking there. Oh, no hookers either. Very disappointed

review.title: Awesome Stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff went above and beyond upgrading our room without us even having to ask. It was very clean, affordable and centrally located! Would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to other travelers.

review.title: Will definitely go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and the staff was great. Only wish they would have told me ahead of time there was a $5.00 charge for parking. It was not bad considering the price I paid for hotel, but it is good to know ahead of time.

review.title: View of the roof
review.reviewText: Got a 2nd Flr room with a "view" of the HVAC equipment on the roof. OK for 1 night, but not more than 1. Parking was reasonable but extra-not disclosed in advance.

review.title: Not at all Hilton-like.
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for 8 nights, but had a horrible experience. They _overcharged_ my credit card (for almost DOUBLE the amount). I wouldn't have been noticed it. Eventhough they adjusted the amount, I was very upset. I mean we give our CC-numbers to merchants on a certain faith, and they have no business making unauthorized charges to it. I had to literally fight with the general manager to get a night-rent free (I can't believe she thought I was being unreasonable). In addition to the above, the hotel's facilities were very commonplace -- didn't seem like staying at a Hilton at all. Half of the times their shuttle service wasn't available, the toileteries aren't complimentary -- just to name a couple of suprises.

review.title: We'll definitely stay there whenever we're in the Bay area
review.reviewText: Nice room with a very comfortable bed, at a good rate.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay. However, the hotel could do away with $5.00 per day parking fee. The hidden charge irritate me.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice for a weekend getaway to the Bay area! Location can't be beat with easy access to freeways, and minutes from San Francisco. The hotel is clean with spacious clean rooms. I Loved It! This will definately be my hotel of choice!

review.title: So helpful!
review.reviewText: They had no problem picking me up and taking me to the train station in the morning!

review.title: San Fran Adjacent
review.reviewText: Good hotel if visiting the bay area or Berkeley.Only negative is charging for parking.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel. It's a nice hotel that is close to San Francisco but much cheaper than similar hotels right in the city. A buffet breakfast was included in the price - much nicer than at other hotels.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location for travel to the North Bay, the South Bay, and San Fransisco. The staff was very helpful.

review.title: Very comfortable and convenient hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for about 2 weeks. This hotel is very convenient. It has a microwave and refrigerator in the hotel room and coin operated laundry in the building. A convenient market is very closed by. For a long stay, it is very helpful. It has a gym but no swimming pool. The room is comfortable. The furniture looks very updated. I hope the room would be a little bigger. The morning coffee from Peet's, and the cookies and fruits for snack in the late afternoon are great. The problem that I had with the room was my room face the highway and a gas station right down there, the noise from the highway plus the noise from some motorcycle gangs hung out at the gas station on one weekend late night and early morning kept me up pretty much the whole night.

review.title: will definitely use again
review.reviewText: We travel often and we found this hotel had everything we find to be important in a hotel. Cleanliness, appeal, organized, comfortable, pleasant. We were very satisfied.

review.title: Nicely remodeled
review.reviewText: Great breakfast as it was complimentary during our stay. Gotta try making your own waffles, loved it. The young African-American man(sorry I wish I could remember his name) who checked us in was overwhelmed, surprising as we arrived at 22:20. Poor guy had no other front desk help and he was busy checking in three parties before myself on top of making change for people purchasing food at their "pantry mart" and driving directions for others for a late night supper as the kitchen was closed. I think they may look ahead at their bookings while scheduling their employees. He performed well under pressure and was very hospitable. Very admirable. I asked that our room assignment was a quiet on and he did oblige and it even had a bay view.

review.title: Clean, reasonable hotel
review.reviewText: Nice updated rooms with good bathrooms and in-room frig; be aware they charge for parking.

review.title: Friendly and helpful, great location
review.reviewText: The staff was friendlier than almost any I've encountered elsewhere. When I had trouble with the desk chair they had maintenance there in under 2 minutes and the problem was fixed completely. The hotel is seconds off Hwy 80 so easy to find and right down the road from a yacht club with beautiful sights and walking paths on the bay. I highly recommend it.

review.title: Great budget hotel for the Berkeley/Emeryville Area
review.reviewText: It was a nice, clean hotel, perfect for our trip to Berkeley. It was only a 5-7 minute drive away, and the price was about half of the hotels actually located in Berkeley. It's also directly across the street from the main Emeryville outdoor mall, with a ton of restaurants and shops. Keep in mind parking is an $5 extra per night. At the hotel I used the gym, which was basic but clean and well maintained. They had free weights/weight machines, treadmills, a bike and an ellipse machine. Nice Neutrogena amenities were given in the bathroom (in the room), and the shower was great!

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: We arrived after 9 pm. The bedside lamp in our room had a faulty switch. A hotel maintenance worker arrived within 5 minutes of my conversation with the front desk and the lamp was completely repaired within 30 min. A quiet room with an excellent breakfast included the next morning.

review.title: won't go back
review.reviewText: this was not our first stay at the hotel. We had recommended the hotel to others. After our last visit, we will not go back. Carlos- manager who wouldn't give us his last name definitely needs remedial classes in customer satisfaction.We notified Hilton's customer service but received a poor response.

review.title: Hidden Gem in Plain Sight
review.reviewText: Accessible and picturesque place to stay with beautiful bay walks along the peninsula.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Located on SF Bay and at the intersection of I-80, 880, and the Bay Bridge, this hotel is ideally situated to serve as an easy-access base for Bay Area excursions and day trips to the Napa Valley.

review.title: nice bay view
review.reviewText: my room was on the 9 floor it was a nice view of the bay

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hilton Garden Inn, Emeryville, CA far exceeded my expections. Check in was fast, efficient and easy. The room was in excellent condition, large, clean and comfortable. My only complaint was you have to pay for parking in their outside lot. Other than that, the hotel is a place anyone should enjoy.

review.title: Excellent value.
review.reviewText: I was completely satisfied with this delightful hotel. Quiet, comfortable, clean, and well run. The restaurant was likewise, with a comprehensive menu and good service. An excellent value, and I will be returning.

review.title: Great Deal for a Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Room was very comfy and well kept. Freeway a bit noisy, but not a real problem. High speed internet worked easily. Free breakfast buffet was a great way to start the day!

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Extremely convenient location vis a vis the freeway. Surprisingly quiet even though we were assigned a room two doors down from the busy elevator shafts -- solely attributable to the room facing the Bay. Very accommodating staff at the front desk.

review.title: Great Buffet Breakfast!
review.reviewText: We stayed here while packing up our daughter to come home from Berkeley for the summer. We love Emeryville-great location! We have tried most of the hotels there. Our room was a little small but very comfortable. It had a microwave and empty refrigerator. Nice bar at hote. The breakfast was excellent-lots of choices and fresh fruit. Good price thru Expedia! Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Comfort By The Bay
review.reviewText: Although not your common Hilton with all the spark and even a pool, the outside of the Hilton Garden Inn will quickly mislead you into thinking you're in for a disaster if you think name first. But, once another hotel taken over by the Hilton, you will pleasantly be surprised by what this Hilton has done with its newest addition to the family. The interior, rooms, restaurant, room service and even staff will have you coming back for more.

review.title: I'll Be Back
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, surprisingly quiet(next to the freeway), easy free parking, free internet access, great location, competitive price...what more could you want?

review.title: Hilton!
review.reviewText: Typical Hilton. Great quality, great service, very comfortable and close to freeway.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideal for the purposes of my trip. I was a woman travelling alone and needed to be near the Amtrak station at Emeryville (the main station for San Francisco). The hotel does not pretend to be a 5 star luxury experience, but it was very clean, very comfortable, the staff were exceedingly courteous and helpful, but above all, I felt incredibly safe. Next time I need to use Amtrak out of Emeryville, I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel.

review.title: Good location & Great Staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is typical for one in its price range. Most important to me are cleanliness of the room, upkeep of hotel and performance of the staff. This hotel had ranked high in all areas.

review.title: improvement over holiday inn
review.reviewText: this was a pleasant surprise, a big improvement over the former holiday inn.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: the staff was helpful, the room was spacious and extremely comfortable, and check-out a breeze. great location -- minutes away from Bay Street Mall, IKEA, and the Bay Bridge (i could also see it from my room). Denny's is walking distance if you'd like a late night snack.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: we liked this place; conveniently located (SF is just a bridge away; can go to Napa valley bypassing SF traffic), well maintained, free parking, free and excellent breakfast - one of the best in terms of value for money i ever got.

review.title: Great location, great stay
review.reviewText: We have stayed many times at this hotel and always enjoy it. It's location, easy on to the Bridge to San Francisco for a great dinner and then the next morning to zoom out of the are to Southern California makes it priceless. Staff is always professional and accommodating.

review.title: Loved It
review.reviewText: I loved it all. Don't have time to explain, but not only was everything up to standards, there wasn't a single thing I can think of that I was even disatisfied with.

review.title: Nice for the area
review.reviewText: Good hotel if you need to be in the burbs of San Francisco. Easy access to the highway / Bay Bridge. Room was clean and plenty comfortable.

review.title: Good Deal, Service and Accomodations
review.reviewText: The quality of the accomodations for the price we paid was excellent. Front Desk service was friendly and the rooms where very comfortable.

review.title: Avoid on weekends.
review.reviewText: Our mistake was to book this hotel on a summer weekend. The hotel lobby was filled with bowlers from nearby Oakland who were noisy and milled around the lobby area all day. Our room on the second floor had a complete view of the building's air conditioning unit, which ran the entire length of west side of the second floor. It was a bit noisy but we did not complain as we were only staying for the weekend and the front desk personnel didn't look very accomodating. On the postive side, the parking was free, the hotel had a restaurant and it was 2 blocks from the upscale retail stores in the town. The other hotels in the city are better located and have a nicer environment. AAA rates the hotel a three and that isn't even close.

review.title: The king size bed rooms are the best ones!
review.reviewText: Stay away from the rooms facing the freeway, too much noise.

review.title: Highly recommend
review.reviewText: For one brief night (arrived 11pm, left 9am), we stayed in a clean, pleasant room with modern decor. The king size bed's comforter was refreshingly white and soft. We were especially pleased with the provision of ample towels, Neutrogena mouthwash and refrigerator. The downside of our experience was the very slow, relatively unresponsive front desk service during checkout. We frequent many hotels and this is by far the longest checkout. There were two clerks and a manager, and it required a bit of bellowing for moderately-paced execution of a routine task. Next time, I know to give them 20 minutes to complete check out. Because of its location in Emeryville next to the highway, it's an easy place to reach local places like Berkeley and San Francisco. I highly recommend this place for tired weary travelers for a bit of rejuvenation.

review.title: A nice place
review.reviewText: It is above average. The only thing not too attractive is no good cafe or restaurant in proximity. The hotel restaurant is extremely expensive.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We were from out of town so did not know our way around, but with this location it was perfect to go out sight seeing from the hotel. The AAA book in highlights showed a free breakfast but it was not available, just the over priced breakfast menue.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Loved it...they worked out an issue I had with my reservation (not one they caused)without any hesitation. Everything was great~

review.title: Unfriendly, Uncaring Staff too Bored to be accommodatng
review.reviewText: I know that certain requests are not guaranteed, but to strike out 3 times, says to me that they are not trying too hard to please. I asked for a bay view, a high floor, and a room not next to the elevator.I explained that I was a repeat customer, who would be using the hotel again in a few months. I got a room on the second floor with a view of the parking lot directly across the elevator. When I checked in,the hotel clerk told me none of these amenities were available. She would not make eye contact, was short and snippy and had an attitude. If she had been friendly, and nicely explained that truly my requests could not be met, I would not have minded too much. It was here attitude more tahn anything that was a turnoff. However, everytime someone used the elevator,I could hear the ding-ding from my room. Also, after putting up with 3 nights of hearing the TV blaring through the thin walls of the next room, I decided to call the desk and complained. Again I detected an attitude and absolutely nothing was done. !5 minutes later I called again, and another person helped me. She called the adjoining room, and the TV was immediately lowered. YOu get nothing,beyond the basics, no continental breakfastor complimentary wine. If you just need a place to sleep, bring ear plugs, and this place will do in a pinch.As for me, next time I'll try another hotel even though this hotel has the best location for my particular needs.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Atmosphere is excellent, room very comfortable, good value

review.title: Great Deal For The Bay!!
review.reviewText: I absolutely loved my time at the Hilton in Emeryille!! It's centrally located and minutes from San Francisco and The East Bay cities!! The price was phenomenal and the facilites were outstanding!! I plan on staying again on my next trip to the Bay.

review.title: Recommend highly
review.reviewText: Couldn't ask for anything else. Room was beautiful,clean and comfortable. Desk staff was very efficient and fast. You can walk to Chevy's (Mexican food) and get a table w/ a beautiful view of the bay.

review.title: Loved the hotel
review.reviewText: The Hilton Garden Inn was centrally located. Although we had to wait 30 min for our room to be cleaned, even after we arrived well after check in time. There was no concierge service. We had a nice bay view (but the windows needed cleaning)and the city view was nice also. We were very happy with the room, the beds were very comfortable. The room was modern and clean with a flat panel TV.

review.title: Pleasant visit
review.reviewText: Easy access. Pleasant surroundings.

review.title: convenient comfort
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful, room was clean, well-appointed, and comfortable. Staff was very polite and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel with Hilton Garden Inn quality
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. If you are up for paying the Hilton Garden Inn price, you won't be disappointed. 10-15 minutes' walk from Amtrak Emeryville Station.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean. All staff very helpful and friendly

review.title: Wait for TV upgrades
review.reviewText: Overall, a good place to stay. Currently upgrading their TVs to flat panels. During this upgrade they are not offering any pay-per-view options. If you like to watch movies from the comfort of your room, bring your laptop or portable DVD player.

review.title: Big Improvement over the last ownership
review.reviewText: For many years, this hotel was part of a different chain. The location is great; it was a landmark. We stayed there many times in spite of some issues with the rooms and amenities because of its convenience. With new ownership, the higher quality of the furnishings and overall improvement in cleanliness and comfort was quite obvious. However, there are some things we didn't like. First, there is an overpowering perfumy smell in the halls which, thankfully, didn't seep into the room. Second, the previously-working hi-speed wireless service was no longer functioning. Since my husband and I both had our laptops with us expecting the same service, we were disappointed at the lack of internet connection. But for the most part, the hotel is worth it for the same reason we liked it before: the location and the ease of free parking in a large, secure lot. This last is a major plus.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location was centralized to the areas we needed to be. Very easy to get to and from this hotel. All staff were friendly and courteous. The dining room and bar were nice.
